learning_content.title: Kia German ziada mukhtalif hai? Bunyadi Tips aur patterns
learning_content.content:
German seekhna aam tor par mushkil qarar paya jata hai. Mark Twain ne 1880 mein mash'hoor andaz mein isey 'bhayanak German zuban' ka naam diya, woh issey slipshod, systemless, slippery aur haath se nikalne wali zuban keh kar ehtejaj karte thay (Mark Twain, 'The awful German language', The Tramp Abroad, 1880 (Harmondsworth: Penguin 1997), pp. 390–402).

Magar kya yeh sach hai?German seekhne mein aik cheez jo bohat madadgar hai woh yeh hai ke yeh aik systematic zuban hai, jo rules ko follow karti hai. In rules ko seekhne ke bohat se tareeke hain, aur kuch tips bhi hain jo aapko is zuban ko seekhne mein madadgar hongi.

Agar aap step by step is zuban ko samajhte jain to aap yeh samajh jayenge ke yeh shayad aap sochte hain se ziada asaan hai. Yahan kuch basic principles diye gaye hain jahan German English se mukhtalif hai, aur jo aapke liye grammar shuru karne se pehle kaam aa sakte hain.

learning_content.title: Imalai - Baray huruf aur mukhtalif characters
learning_content.content:
German ki spelling English se mukhtaliftarike se mukhtalif hai. Zarorat parne par Noun ke liye baray huruf.

German zuban un kam zubano mein se aik hai jo baray huruf siraf jumle ki shuruaat mein nahi balki jumle ke beech mein bhi istemal karti hai. English mein yeh siraf proper names, personal pronoun 'I' aur personifications, jaise 'Love' ke liye lagu hota hai.

German mein, tamam nouns hamesha baray huruf se likhe jaate hain, maslan:

Der Mann und die Frau arbeiten jeden Tag am Computer.

Har roz admi aur aurat apne computer par kam karte hain.

Note that the pronoun ich ('I') has no initial capital in German, but Sie (formal form of 'you') has.

learning_content.title: Alag Alag Alfaz
learning_content.content:
German alphabet mai kuch characters hain jo English alphabet mai mojood nahi hoty:
ß – the sharp ‘s’
German mai yeh harf eszett ke naam se jana jata hai, iski talaffuz 's' ki tarha hoti hai, jaisa ke ‘sun’ ya ‘basic’ mai hota hai. German is harf ka istemal 'ei' aur 'ie' ke baad, aur 'a', 'o', 'u' ke baad karta hai jab woh lamba talaffuz hoty hain.

learning_content.title: The umlauts – ä, ö, ü
learning_content.content:
Yeh bohat zaroori hain. Yeh alfaz ki talaffuz aur matlab dono ko badal detay hain:
Mutter ka matlab ‘mother’ hota hai, lekin Mütter plural form hai aur iska matlab ‘mothers’ hota hai. Musste ka matlab 'had to' hota hai, lekin müsste ka matlab ‘should’ ya ‘ought to’ hota hai.

learning_content.title: Tin Gender
learning_content.content:
German mai tamam noum ya to masculine, feminine ya neuter hotay hain. Yeh unke singular article mai zahir hota hai: der masculine ke liye, die feminine ke liye, das neuter ke liye.
Yeh samajhna zaroori hai ke German mai gender grammatical hota hai, biological nahi jaisa ke English mai hota hai. Isska matlab yeh hai ke objects, concepts waghera jo English mai neuter (‘it’) hotay hain, woh German mai masculine, feminine ya neuter ho saktay hain:
der Tisch
the table (masculine)
die Tür
the door (feminine)
das Fenster
the window (neuter)

learning_content.title: Endings
learning_content.content: English aur German mai aik bara farq yeh hai ke German mai alfaz specific endings letay hain jab woh dosray words se taluq rakhtay hain. Jab bhi aap naya noun sekhtay hain, hamesha isske gender ke sath sikhen: behtareen tarika yeh hai ke aap noun ko usske article ke sath seekhen. Aap dekhenge ke yeh long term mai faida mand sabit hoga.

learning_content.title: Verbs
learning_content.content: Ye wo alfaz hain jo aik jumlay ki 'karwai' ko bayan kartay hain, jaisay ke 'daurna', 'sochna'. Misaal ke taur par, German feal 'to go' jab 'I', 'he' aur 'they' ke sath istemal hota hai to iskay akhir mein tabdeel ho jata hai: Ich gehe (Mai chalta hoon), Er geht (Wo chalta hain), Sie gehen (Ye chaltay hain).

learning_content.title: Articles and possessive adjectives
learning_content.content: Ye wo alfaz hain jo aik sangya se jure hue hote hain jaise ki 'a', 'the', 'my' ya 'his'. Misaal ke taur par, German mein jab aik ghair muqarara muqam ('a') sangya se jura hota hai, to yeh jumlay ke mozoo (ein Mann) ya jumlay ki mafoom (einen Mann) ke sath tabdeel ho jata hai: Ist das ein Mann? (Kia wo aadmi hain?), Da drüben sehe ich einen Mann (Main wahan pe aik aadmi ko dekh sakta hoon).

learning_content.title: Adjectives
learning_content.content: Ye wo alfaz hain, jo sangya ki khasiyat ko bayan kartay hain, jaisay ke 'new' computer, an 'intelligent' woman, a 'beautiful' house, German adjectives jab wo aik sangya ke samnay hotay hain to unka kuch patern hota hai. German mein adjectives jab aik muzakar sangya (ein neuer Computer), aik maada sangya (eine intelligente Frau) ya aik na mardana na zanana sangya (ein schönes Haus) se jure hotay hain to unka akhir tabdeel ho jata hai.

learning_content.title: Cases
learning_content.content: German ki ek sab se zaroori khasiyat ye hai ke aap jumlay ke aik noun ka kirdar us k akhir aur article ke form se jan sakte hain. Ye us ki sæt ko dikhatay hain. Misaal ke taur par, aik noun jumlay ka mozoo ho sakta hai, yani 'karta' jo kisi kaam mein ho: Der Hund beißt den Mann (Kutta aadmi ko kaat raha hai). Ya phir ke wo jumlay ka mafoom ho, i.e. kaam ka 'receiver': Der Hund beißt den Mann (Kutta aadmi ko kaat raha hai).

learning_content.title: Moamlaat ka Tarteeb
learning_content.content:
German zuban mein yeh bohat zaroori hai keh aap moamlaat ka sahih tarteeb jaanain. Finite verb hamesha doosri jaga per aati hai taqreban tamam afraad mein:

Er hat zwei Brüder.(Wo do bhai rakhta hai.)

Morgen fahre ich nach Manchester.(Kal main Manchester ja raha hoon.)

finite verb fiqra ke shuru mein orders aur bohat se sawalon mein ati hai:

Öffnet das Fenster!(Darwaza kholo, baraye meherbani.)

Hast Du morgen Zeit?(Kya tum kal farigh ho?)

Tenses hamesha akhir mein ate hain:

Ich kann morgen nicht kommen, weil ich nach Manchester fahre.(Main kal nahi aa sakta kyunke mai Manchester ja raha hoon.)

Agar do verb forms hoti hain, toh aik un mein se akhir mein jati hai:

Morgen muss ich nach Manchester fahren.(Kal mujhe Manchester jaana hoga.)

learning_content.title: Mazi ya Past Tense
learning_content.content:
English mazi mein ya toh present perfect tense istemal hota hai (jab kuch haal hi mein hua ho ya present se connection ho: 'I was' etc)

Lekin German mein, aisa farq nahi parta. Dono jumlo mein finite verb form same hota hai:

Ich arbeite.(Main kaam kar raha hoon.)

Ich arbeite bei Harrods.(Main Harrods mein kaam karta hoon.)

learning_content.title: German ka Nizaam aur Asool
learning_content.content: German ek bohat zyada systematic zubaan hai, aur buhat jaldi aapko ehsaas ho jayega ke kuch specific patterns bar bar roo baroo hotay hain. Agar aap ye dehaan mein rakhain toh aap dekhain ge ke, pehlay kuch haftoon ki kafi tedha learning curve ke baad, cheezain asaan hojain ge or aap inhe patterns ko samajh paain ge.

learning_content.title: Bhetareen Dictionary ki Talaash
learning_content.content: Ek achi dictionary kharidein. Ye sirf aapko translations provide nahi karti balke aapko ye bhi batati hai ke kese aap unfamiliar words pronounce karain aur aapko important grammatical maloomati bhi deti hai, misaal ke taur par ke aik verb kis case ko leta hai ya aik noun ka plural kya hai. iss kitab ke dauraan, hum aapko batatay hai ke kese aap dictionaries ke saath kaam karain toh iss kisam ki maloomat mile aur isski kya relevancy hai.

learning_content.title: Jaanchna: Kuch Zaroori baatein
learning_content.content:
1. German mein capital letters kab istemal hotay hain?
2. Aap letter ß kab istemal kartey hain?
3. Umlauts ki kya importance hai?
4. German aur English istemaal hone wali gender mein kya farq hai?
5. Koi aisi misaal dejiye jahan German word apni ending change karta hai.
6. German word order par zyada asar dalne wala sab se bara principle kya hai?
7. ‘Main kaam kar raha hoon’ aur ‘Main kaam karta hoon’ mein German main kya faraq hai?

learning_content.title: Verbs in the present tense
learning_content.content: Verbs mojooda zamane mein kya hoty hain? Aik verb aam tor par ye bayaan karta hai ke shakhs ya koi bhi dosra muzoo kya kar raha hota hai: ‘Mein cinema jata hoon’ ‘Wo apni chuttiyon ke bare mein sochti hai’ ‘Wo football khailte hain’

learning_content.title: What is a verb?
learning_content.content: Verb kya hai? Ye bhi aik halat ko bayan kar sakta hai: ‘Wo gussa hai’ ‘Wo wahan rehti hai’ ‘Wo mujhse mohabbat karte hain.

learning_content.title: Verbs in English
learning_content.content: Angrezi mein, verbs ko sirf mojooda zamane mein teesray shakhs ki wahid form ke siwa kisi bhi form mein nahin rakha jata. Ap kehengy: ‘I go’, ‘you go’, ‘he/she/it goes’, ‘we go’, ‘you go’, ‘they go’.

learning_content.title: Verb Formation
learning_content.content: German mein verbs ki formation English ki nisbat zyada hoti hai. Ap verb ki stem lete hain phir zaroori ending shamil karte hain. Stem wo form hota hai jo infinitive ke bina -en ya -n hota hai.

learning_content.title: Finite aur Infinitive Verbs
learning_content.content: Aik verb jiski ending hoti hai usko finite verb kehte hain (infinitive ke muqable jo kisi meaningful ending ka muzahir nahin hota). Ye aik ahem grammatical term hai, aur aap isko units mein kafi dekhenge.

learning_content.title: Verb Endings Detail mein
learning_content.content: Agarcha aap ek shuruat karne wale hain, aap shayad zyada tar pehle aur doosre shakhs ki ek adaad (ich aur du ya Sie) ka istemal karte hain lekin verbs ke tamam endings ke baray mein jan'na zaroori hai. Yahan wo detail mein diye gaye hain.

learning_content.title: Verb Forms Aur Unke Istemal
learning_content.content:
Ich ('I'): Pehle shakhs ki singular ke liye, aap stem ke sath -e jortay hain. Misal ke taur pe, 'Ich wohne in Frankfurt.' ka matlab hai 'Main Frankfurt mein rehta hoon.'
du/Sie ('you', singular): German mein adress karne ke do forms hain: informal aur formal. Agar aap ek shakhs se baat kar rahe hain, to informal adress du hai aur formal Sie hai (hamesha aik shuruati capital letter ke sath). Endings -st aur -en hain. Misal ke taur pe, 'Woher kommst du?' ka matlab hai 'Tum kahan se aye ho?' (informal)
er/sie/es ('he', 'she', 'it'): Teesre shakhsi ya cheez ke baray mein baat karte waqt, aap german mein er ke liye 'he', sie ke liye 'she' aur es ke liye 'it' ka istemal kartay hain aur stem ke sath -t shamil kartay hain.
ich (I)du (you, informal)Sie (you, formal)er/sie/es (he/she/it)wir (we)ihr (you, plural, informal)Sie (you, plural, formal)sie (they)
komm-enkommekommstkommenkommtkommenkommtkommenkommen
wohn-enwohnewohnstwohnenwohntwohnenwohntwohnenwohnen
hör-enhörehörsthörenhörthörenhörthörenhören

learning_content.title: Introduction to Plural Forms
learning_content.content:
Hamam ab aam tor par asaan zaban ki shakal mai sikhain gai. 'We' (ham) liyai -en istemal hota hai jo aksar inﬁnitives mai bhi istemal hota hai. Jaisa ke:
  • Ham Cologne mai rehtai hain - Wir wohnen in Köln.
  • Ham German seekh rahe hain - Wir lernen Deutsch.

learning_content.title: Informal and Formal 'You' in Plural
learning_content.content:
Singular ki tarha, zyada se zyada ek shakhs se bat karnai ke liyai informal (ihr) aur aik formal tariqa (Sie) dono istemal ho sakte hain. Dono ka istemal alag hai, jaise:
  • Aap kahan rehtai hain? (plural, informal) - Wo wohnt ihr?
  • Aap yahan kya kar rahe ho? (plural, informal) - Was macht ihr hier?
  • Aap kahan rehtai hain? (plural, formal) - Wo wohnen Sie?
  • Aap yahan kya kar rahe ho? (plural, formal) - Was machen Sie hier?

learning_content.title: Usage of sie/Sie
learning_content.content:
Jab ap German seekhna start kartai hain, to 'sie' word ke mukhtalif matlab apko confuse kar sakte hain.
  • 'sie' chote s ke sath 'she' ya 'they' ka matlab hota hai.
  • 'Sie' bade S ke sath formal 'you' ke liyai istemal hota hai, dono singular mai bhi aur plural mai bhi.

learning_content.title: One present tense in German
learning_content.content:
Jaisa ke humne dekha, German mein sirf ek present tense hota hai, jo English ke simple aur continous present dono ko darshata hai. Jaise ki:

  • Er trinkt Bier (He drinks beer or He is drinking beer)
  • Sie spielt Fußball (She plays football or She is playing football)

learning_content.title: Exceptions
learning_content.content:
German mein adhikatar verbs upar bataaye gaye niyam ko follow karte hain, lekin kuch apvaad (irregular forms) hote hain:

  • Kuch verbs mein halki spelling variatoins hoti hai, ya unka stem vowel badalta hai (Unit 3 dekhe).
  • Sein aur haben (‘to be’ or ‘to have’) vishesh roop se irregular hote hain (Unit 4 dekhe).

learning_content.title: Important pointers
learning_content.content: German verb endings ke mysteries ko aage explore karne se pehle, yeh sunishchit kar lein ki aapne is Unit se saari jaankari acche se samajh li hai.

learning_content.title: Informal Conversation Interview
learning_content.content:
Ye aik choti si interview hai Alex Maschke ki, jo ke Berlin mai rehte hain. Mozoati verb forms se gaps ko pura karein.

t

ttExample: ttkommen → Woher ttdu? – Ich tt aus Frankfurt. tt→ Woher kommst du? – Ich komme aus Frankfurt. t

Jesa ke aap ne notice kiya hoga, Alex ko be takallufi se address kiya gaya hai. Sawalat ko formal mode mai (Sie form ka use kar ke) phir se likhein.

learning_content.title: Exercise 2.3
learning_content.content:
Ghariab nawisi se mutaliq muqarara saron ki supply karein.

t

ttExample: ttAnna komm tt aus Wien. tt→ Anna kommt aus Wien. t

learning_content.title: Exercise 2.4
learning_content.content:
Mandarja zail jumlaat ka tarjuma karein:
1. Mai Berlin mai rehta hoon.
2. Woh beer peeta hai.
3. Woh tennis khelti hai.
4. Carla aur Sophia football khel rahi hain.
5. Tum kahan se ho? (a) Tum aa rahi ho aur (b) Aap form use karein.
6. Tum kahan rehte ho? (a) Tum, (b) Aap-form aur (c) Ihr form use karein.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. Kya aap German verb ka stem form kar sakte hain?
2. Singular mai verb endings kya hain?
3. Plural mai endings kya hoti hain?
4. German mai kitne tenses hote hain for the present?
5. Kya aap finite verb ki tareef kar sakte hain?

unit_name: Unit Teen: Verb ke mukhtalif Iqsam aur beqaaidah verbs

learning_content.title: Maamooli aur Beqaaidah Shikal
learning_content.content: German mein ziyada tar verbs ek maamooli pattern follow karte hain jahan ending sirf verb ke stem par lagti hai. Lekin kuch variations aise hote hain jahan spelling thori alag hoti hai. Ek beqaaidah verbs ki group bhi hoti hai jahan verb ke stem mein tabdeeli hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Beqaaidah Forms in English
learning_content.content: English mein bhi maamooli aur beqaaidah verbs mein farq hota hai, lekin yeh aam tor par present tense par asar nahi karti, 'to be' aur 'to have' ke ilawa. In verbs ka Unit 4 mein tafseel se zikr kiya gaya hai.

learning_content.title: Spelling Variations - Aik Jaaiza
learning_content.content:
Stem endings ka -d ya -t
Kuch German verbs hoti hain jahan stem -d ya -t par khatam hoti hai. Yeh mushkil hota hai ke du aur er/sie/es aur ihr ke -st endings ko pronounce kiya jaye agar -st ya -t seedha stem ke sath joda jaye. Isi liye in endings se pehle e rakha jata hai:
Verbs jaise ke atmen aur regnen
Verbs jaise ke atmen aur regnen, jahan stem aik consonant + n ya m par khatam hoti hai, isInko bhi additional e ki zaroorat hoti hai:
infinite
stem
finite verb
arbeiten
arbeit
du arbeitest
kaam karna
kosten
kost
es kostet
iqsaam
reden
red
ihr redet
baat karna

learning_content.title: Naamumkin fe'al k saath guta mien tabdeeli
learning_content.content: German zabaan mein kuch verbs hotay hain jin ka 'present tense' mein stem mein a, e, or i vowel ka istemal hota hai. Ye tabdeeli sirf 'du' aur 'er/sie/es' forms par apply hoti hai. Kisi aur ending par asar nahi hota. Neeche kuch maamoolan istemal hone wale verbs key examples di gayi hain.

learning_content.title: Misalain
learning_content.content:
1) Kya aap Harry Potter parhna pasand kartay hain? Liest du gern Harry Potter?
2) Woh football match dekh raha hai. Er sieht ein Fußballspiel.
3) Woh pizza khaana pasand karti hai. Sie isst gern Pizza.
4) Kya aap German bolte hain? Sprichst du Deutsch?
5) Woh gyara baje tak soti hai. Sie schläft bis elf Uhr.

learning_content.title: Patterns ki talash
learning_content.content:
Ye tabdili sirf mehdood tadaad fe'al par apply hoti hai. Behtar yehi hai keh aap inhe yaad karlein. Kuch certain patterns apko predict karne mein madad karte hain. Aapko samajhne mein in patterns ka dhyaan rakhna ehem hai. Ye patterns neeche diye gaye hain:
a → ä
e → i
e → ie

learning_content.title: Tafseelan Tabdeeli
learning_content.content:
Neeche diye gaye verbs mein se important verbs – apart from schlafen – woh hain jin ki pattern is tarha hai ki:
infinative → finite verb
schlafen → er schläft
essen → sie isst
sprechen → du sprichst
lesen → du liest
sehen → er sieht
fahren → du fährst, er/sie/es fährt
halten→ du hältst, er/sie/es hält
tragen → du trägst, er/sie/es trägt
waschen → du wäschst, er/sie/es wäscht

learning_content.title: German Verbs with Vowel Change
learning_content.content:
German mein kuch verbs hain jin ka 'e' vowel 'i' ya 'ie' mein change hojata hai. Jaisay 'sprechen' aur 'essen' aam misalain hain. Kuch dusray misalain niche di gayee hain:

Er hilft Frau Maier - Woh Frau Maier ki madad karta hai.

Triﬀst du heute Angelika? - Kya aap aaj Angelika se mil rahe hain?

Er wirft den Ball zu Beckham - Woh ball Beckham ko phenkta hai.

learning_content.title: Verb 'nehmen' and its Variations
learning_content.content:
Verb 'nehmen' bhi 'e' se 'i' mein change hota hai, lekin iske spellings mein ziyada variations hain. Zara dekhiye:

ich nehme

wir nehmen

du nimmst

ihr nehmt

Sie nehmen

Sie nehmen

er/sie/es nimmt

sie nehmen

learning_content.title: Example Sentences
learning_content.content:
Yaha kuch misalain di gayee hain:

Nimmst du Kaﬀee oder Tee? - Kya aap coffee ya tea lenge?

Er nimmt ein heißes Bad - Woh garam pani ki bath le raha hai.

learning_content.title: Changes from e to ie
learning_content.content:
Kuch verbs jin me e sound lamba bola jata hai, un me e vowel ie mein badal jata hai. Misal ke taur per,

- geben → du gibst, er/sie/es gibt, matlab, 'dena'

- helfen → du hilfst, er/sie/es hilft, matlab, 'madad karna'

- treﬀen → du triﬀst, er/sie/es triﬀt, matlab, 'milna'

- werfen → du wirfst, er/sie/es wirft, matlab, 'phenkna'

- sehen → du siehst, er/sie/es sieht, matlab, 'dekhna'

- lesen → du liest, er/sie/es liest, matlab, 'parhna'

learning_content.title: Irregular Verbs
learning_content.content: Irregular Verbs may vo hotay hain jin ki tahajji present tense mai tabdeel hojati hai. In verbs ko aap kisi bhi course kitab ya dictionary k pechay dekh saktay hain. Lekin yaad rakhain k har irregular verb ki tahajji present tense mai tabdeel nahi hoti.

learning_content.title: Other Irregular Verbs
learning_content.content: Maziya Zarb mai do aur groups hotay hain jin ki tahajji regular pattern k mutabiq nahi hoti. Ye groups hain:   -sein aur haben yaani 'to be' aur 'to have' (Unit 4 dekhe)  -modal verbs (Unit 18 dekhe)

learning_content.title: Exercise 3.3
learning_content.content:
Yahan Hans Homann, aik naujawan television paishkar jis ka taluq Austria se hai, khud ke bare mein kiya kehte hain. Is maloomat ka istemaal karke unki mukhtasir tasveer likhen. Pehla jumla aap ke liye kar diya gaya hai.
  1. Mera naam Hans Homann hai. → Unka naam Hans Homann hai.
  2. Main Vienna se hoon.
  3. Main Austrian Television ke liye kaam karta hoon.
  4. Main waziha taur par German bolta hoon, lekin English aur Spanish bhi bolta hoon.
  5. Main detective novels parhne ka shoqeen hoon.
  6. Main skiing aur swimming bhi bohot shoq se karta hoon.
  7. Mujhe Marlene Dietrich ke purane films dekhne ka shoq hai.
  8. Main aksar dair tak sota hoon.
  9. Main safar karne ka shoqeen hoon.
  10. Aur main hafte ke akhri dinon mein boorhoon ki madad karta hoon.

learning_content.title: Exercise 3.4
learning_content.content:
Niche diye gaye jumlo ko German mein translate karen:
  1. Wo kitab parta hai.
  2. Peter German aur English bolta hai.
  3. Hum German aur Spanish bolte hain.
  4. Magda ko pizza khane ka shoq hai.
  5. Main ik beer lunga, baraye meherbani.
  6. Uske pass ek beer hai.
  7. Wo aik T-shirt pehen raha hai.
  8. Baarish ho rahi hai.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1 Kya aap yaad rakhsakte hain keh konse endings ke liye aik stem vowel change hai?
2 Kya aap identify kar sakte hain keh aapko ek additional e kab use karna hai?
3 Stem ke end par agar s sound hai tou apko kya yaad rakhna hai?
4 Sabse common stem vowel changes konse hain?

learning_content.title: Irregular verbs: haben and sein
learning_content.content: Irregular verbs haben 'to have' aur sein ‘to be’ dono bohot zaruri hain. Ye German zaban mein, English ki tarah, kaafi irregular hotay hain.

learning_content.title: Different patterns
learning_content.content:
Unit 3 mein samjaya gaya tha, German mein irregular verbs ka stem vowel aksar change hota hai. Present tense mein yeh kabhi kabhi du aur er/sie/es forms ko affect karta hai. Sein English ki 'to be' k muqabley mein aur bhi zyada irregular verb hai jiska ending kaafi change hota hai.
Jaise ke English mein 'I am', 'you are', 'he/she/it is', 'we are', 'you are', 'they are'

learning_content.title: Haben and sein – an overview
learning_content.content:
Haben aur Sein k verb forms ka Jaiza:

  • ich (I)
    • habe
    • bin
  • du (you, informal)
    • hast
    • bist
  • Sie (you, formal)
    • haben
    • sind
  • er/sie/es (he/she/it)
    • hat
    • ist
  • wir (we)
    • haben
    • sind

learning_content.title: Haben Detail Mein
learning_content.content:
Haben jo german mein 'have' ka matlab hota hai uski detail yaha pe bayan ki ja rahi hai.
Kuch patterns hain haben ke jo yaad rakhne mein asani karte hain.
Ich, wir, ihr aur sie ke liye endings kaafi regular hain: unhe aam taur par stem se juda jata hai:
ich hab-e, wir hab-en, ihr hab-t, sie hab-en.
Sirf du aur er/sie/es ke liye finite verb form irregular hoti hai – isme apko stem se b ko drop karna parta hai:
du hast, er/sie/es hat.

learning_content.title: Haben Ka Istemal
learning_content.content:
Haben kaafi zaruri verb hai jiska bohot istemal karte hain. Is ka istemal English ki 'to have' ki tarah hota hai:
Ich habe gesungen.
Yaani ke,
Maine gaaya.
Yaha kuch phrases bhi diye gaye hain jinme haben ka istemal hua hai:

learning_content.title: Mufeed Phrases
learning_content.content:
Hunger haben ka matlab hota hai bhukha hona;
Ich habe Hunger.
Yaani,
Mujhe bhukh lagi hai.
Durst haben ka matlab hota hai pyaas hona;
Er hat Durst.
Yaani,
Usse pyaas lagi hai.
Isi tarah se aur phrases hain:

learning_content.title: Sein Detail Mai
learning_content.content:
Sein verb bohat irregular hai, aur isko by heart yaad kia jana parhta hai: ich bin, du bist, Sie sind, er/sie/es ist, wir sind, ihr seid, Sie sind, sie sind. Yahaan kuch misalain hain:
'Ich bin aus Deutschland' ka matlab hai 'Main Germany se hon'.
'Sind Sie Herr Schuhmacher?' ka matlab hai 'Kya aap Mr. Schuhmacher hain?'
'Du bist sehr schön' ka matlab hai 'Aap bohat khoobsurat hain.'
'Er ist Amerikaner' ka matlab hai 'Wo Amreeki hai'.
'Sie ist Lehrerin' ka matlab hai 'Wo (female) aik ustad hain.'
'Es ist schwer' ka matlab hai 'Yeh mushkil hai.'
'Entschuldigung, wir sind verspätet' ka matlab hai 'Maazrat, hum late hain.'
'Seid Ihr verheiratet?' ka matlab hai 'Kya aap shadi shuda hain?'
'Wir sind aus Großbritannien' ka matlab hai 'Hum bara britaniya se hain.'
Aur Shakespeare ka famous dialogue: Sein oder Nicht-Sein. Das ist die Frage, jiska matlab hota hai 'Hona ya na hona, yehi sawal hai.'

learning_content.title: Sein Ka Istemaal
learning_content.content:
Sein verb bohat ahem hai aur iski aksar zarurat padti hai. Yeh tenses aur doosre grammatical forms banane ke liye istemaal kiya jata hai.
German language mai sirf aik present tense hota hai. Iska istemaal English ke 'I am going' jese tense banane ke liye nahi hota. Jese 'Ich gehe'.

learning_content.title: Exercise 4.2
learning_content.content: Muzhairah verb form istamal kar ke mukhtasir mukalamaat ko mukammal karein.

learning_content.title: Exercise 4.3
learning_content.content: Ab poore maujooda tense (sab log: main, tum, woh, hum, tum, aap, woh) ke verbs (1) hona aur (2) hona ka poora likhain.

learning_content.title: Exercise 4.4
learning_content.content:
Mandarja zail sentences ko German mein Translate karein:

1- Hum New York se hain.

2- Wo log Australia se hein.

3- Mario Munich se hai.

4- Kya aap Mr Becker hain?

5- Uske paas aik behen hai.

6- Kya aapke paas samay hai?(a) Tum form aur (b) Aap form ke saath.

learning_content.title: Content 1
learning_content.content:
7 Woh logh talib ilm haan.
8 Berlin Germany ki dar-ul-hukumat hai.
9 Mere paas aik flat hai.
10 Hum bhooky hain.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1 Kya aap dil se tamam mukammal verb forms (mojooda zamane mayn) sein ke yaad hain?
2 haben ke liye na mumkinat kya hain?
3 Kya aap kuch mufeed phrases yaad kar saktey hain haben ke saath?

learning_content.title: Separable verbs in the present tense
learning_content.content:
Aik separable verb kya hota hai? Ye wo verbs hain jo do hisson mein taqseem hoti hain: aik prefix aur verb ki infinitive.

Misal ke tor par: auf + stehen → aufstehen 'to get up'.

learning_content.title: Comparison with English
learning_content.content: Separable verbs ko English phrasal verbs se tashbeeh di jasakti hai, jo infinitive aur aik adverb ya preposition ka milaap hoti hain: 'to get up', 'to get on' waghera.

learning_content.title: Important separable verbs
learning_content.content: Separable verbs German mein kafi aam hain. Neechay kuch eham tareen hain: abfahren 'to depart', abholen 'to pick up', abwaschen 'to do the washing up', anfangen 'to start', ankommen 'to arrive', anrufen 'to phone', aufhören 'to stop', aufräumen 'to tidy up', aufstehen 'to get up', ausgehen 'to go out', einkaufen 'to go shopping', einladen 'to invite'.

learning_content.title: Jab aik detachable verb mojood hota hai
learning_content.content: Jab aik detachable verb mojood hota hai, verb ka prefix usually alag hojata hai or sentence k end pr ajata hai. Eg: anrufen → Mr. Nolte rings his wife. aufstehen → Bernhard gets up at five o'clock in the morning. ausgehen → Corinna goes out every day. fernsehen → The children watch television every evening. einkaufen → He goes shopping in the supermarket. stattfinden → The meeting takes place on Monday.

learning_content.title: Jab sentence main do clauses hotay hain
learning_content.content: Jab sentence main do clauses hotay hain, to split off prefix relevant clause k end pr ajata hai. Ye zaruri nahi k sentence k end pr ho. Eg: Clause 1: Ich stehe auf → I get up Clause 2: und dann frühstücke ich. → and then I have breakfast. Clause 1: Herr Carlsen sieht fern, → Mr Carlsen is watching television, Clause 2: aber seine Kinder lesen. → but his children are reading.

learning_content.title: Context
learning_content.content: Dr Schuster sirf bara baje sonay jatay hain, lekin unhain paanch baje uth jana parta hai.

learning_content.title: Verbs can have more than one prefix
learning_content.content:
Ek verb kaafi sari prefix ka istemal kar sakta hai. Yahan humnay 'kommen' verb ka istemal kia hai mukhtalif prefixes ke sath aur is se uska matlab tabdeel hota hai:

ankommen ka matlab hota hai 'to arrive'

mitkommen ka matlab hota hai 'to come along'

weiterkommen means 'to get on'

hereinkommen means 'to come in'

herauskommen means 'to come out'

nachkommen means 'to come later'

zurückkommen means 'to come back'

Aur ek example hai 'steigen' verb ki: einsteigen ka matlab hota hai 'to get in/on', umsteigen ka matlab hota hai 'to change' aur aussteigen ka matlab hota hai 'to get out/oﬀ'

Prefiex ka matlab jan kar ap often guess kar saktay hain. Lakin ye hamesha nahi hota, is liye separable verbs ko yaad karna parta hai

learning_content.title: How to find out whether a verb is separable
learning_content.content: Aap ye maloom kar saktay hain ke aik verb alag ho sakta hai ya nahi, achi dictionary check kar ke. Agar verb alag ho sakta hai to us ke peechay 'sep' likha hua ho ga.

learning_content.title: Common Separable prefixes
learning_content.content:
Common separable prefixes yeh hain:ab-, an-, auf-, aus-, ein-, mit-, nach-, vor-, zu-, zurück-

Aap in prefixes ke examples upar diye gaye sath mein dekh saktay hain.

learning_content.title: Inseparable Prefixes
learning_content.content:
There are also preﬁxes which are inseparable. They include be-, er-, ge- and ver-. Frequently used verbs with inseparable preﬁxes are bezahlen ‘to pay’, erzählen ‘to tell’, verdienen ‘to earn’, verkaufen ‘to sell’ and verstehen ‘to understand’.

As you can see, these preﬁxes do not separate from the verb.

learning_content.title: More about separable verbs
learning_content.content:
As a beginner you will probably use separable verbs most often as explained above. However, separable verbs occur also in the imperative, in combination with modal verbs, and in the perfect and future tense.

If you cannot ﬁnd a separable verb in a verb list or dictionary, look up the verbs without its prefix.

learning_content.title: Ishtehaar 5.4
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences:
1. Main saat bajay utha.
2. Main apna kaam 8 bajay shuru karta hoon.
3. Meeting peer (Monday) ko ho rahi hai.
4. Train kab rawana ho gi?
5. Train kab pohnche gi?
6. Michael saman thik kar raha hai aur us ke bache television dekh rahay hain.
7. Aap cinema k liye saath a rahe hain?

learning_content.title: 1 to 5 - Questions
learning_content.content:
1 Kaunsa hissa verb ka alag kiya jata hai?
2 Ye ek sentence me kaha jata hai?
3 Agar ek sentence me zyada se zyada clause ho to kya hota hai?
4 Aap kaise check kar sakte hain ke verb alag hai?
5 Kya aap ko pata hai ke kaunse prefixes non-separable hain?

learning_content.title: Imperatives
learning_content.content: Imperatives yani hukum kiya jaye. Yeh kisi ko hukum ya dastur dene ke liye istemal kiya jata hai.

learning_content.title: Imperative kya hai?
learning_content.content: Imperative ka istemal hukum dene ya logon ko kuch karne ke liye hukam dene ke liye kiya jata hai.

learning_content.title: Imperative ko English main kaise istemal kiya jata hai
learning_content.content: Edge se jao! Apni kitaben kholo! Khirki band karo! Chahe aap sirf ek shakhs se baat kar rahe hon ya kai logo se, isme koi farq nahi parta.

learning_content.title: German main imperative ki char alag shaklein
learning_content.content: German main imperative thora mazeed uljha hua hai. Yahan alag shaklein hain jo is par depend karti hain ki aap sirf ek shakhs se baat kar rahe hain ya zyada se zyada. German imperative main formal aur informal mode of address ka bhi tafawut karta hai.

learning_content.title: Imperatives - ek jhalak
learning_content.content: Yahan imperative ki alag-alag shaklon ka ek jhalak hai. Lekin yaad rahain ke sirf English ko Roman Urdu main tabdeel kiya gaya hai, German ko nahi.

learning_content.title: Imperatives in more detail
learning_content.content: Ap dekh sakte Hen, 'du', 'Sie' aur 'ihr' form mukhtalif patterns follow karte hen. Formal command ya imperative singular aur plural mein same hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Addressing one person informally (du form)
learning_content.content:
Informal singular ya 'du' form kisi aik shakhs se baat karne ke liye istemal hoti hai jisse aap quite familiar hen – bachon, family ya qareebi dost. Aap verb ke stem ka istemal karke imperative bnate hen baghair kisi ending ke:
Komm her! ( Yahan Aao!)
Trink weniger (Kum Piyo)
Warte (Ruko)
Atme schneller (Tez Saans lo)
Sprich leise (Aram se bolo)
Lies die Zeitung (Akhbar parho).

learning_content.title: Irregular forms
learning_content.content:
Jo verbs kuch variation rakhtei hen unke present tense mein, un mein thori variation hoti hai imperative ke liye:
Verbs jin ka end d, t, consonant + m ya consonant + n se hota hai woh stem ke end mein 'e' add karte hen.
Verbs jin mein stem vowel change hota hai un mein same stem vowel change hota hai imperative mein.
But verbs jo a se ä mein change hoti hen, woh change nahi karte. Woh sirf stem ka use karte hen imperative form banane ke liye:
Anfangen (Shuru Karo)
Haben (Rukhna)
Sein (Ho Jao).

learning_content.title: Separable Verbs
learning_content.content:
Judag ho karne wali verbs apne prefix ko alag kar deti hain aur usko finite verb ke baad ya clause ke end pe rakh deti hain.
'Haben' aur 'sein' jaisi regular verbs ki tarah behave karte hain. Verb ke stem ka istamaal karein.

learning_content.title: Ek Shakhs ko Rasmi Tareekay se Khitab Karna (Sie form)
learning_content.content:
Jab aap apne kisi qareebi se nahi balke kisi ek shakhs ko khitab kar rahe hon, to formal singular ya Sie form istamaal karein.
Ye bas present-tense Sie form ka istamaal hai. Informal ki nisbat formal imperative mein personal pronoun 'Sie' bhi shamil hota hai. Verb ke baad 'Sie' aane se aap samajh sakte hain ke ye imperative hai:
kommen → Kommen Sie, bitte.
Please come.

learning_content.title: Zyada se Zyada Ek Shakhs ko Rasmi Tareeqay se Khitab Karna (ihr form)
learning_content.content: Informal plural tab istamaal hota hai jab aap kam se kam do logon ya aapke waqif logon ---- bachon, family ya doston ---- se khitaab kar rahe hote hain.

learning_content.title: Hab-en
learning_content.content:
Hab Geduld.
Sabar rakho.

learning_content.title: sei-n
learning_content.content:
sei
Hoshiar raho.

learning_content.title: Tashkeel
learning_content.content:
Informal plural wesi banai jati hai jese second person plural (ihr): verb ke stem me t jodte hain.

Verbs jinki stem d, t, consonant + m ya consonant + n per khatam hoti hain, unke ending stem me -et hota hai.

Separable verbs apna prefix alag kar deti hain.

learning_content.title: Misalen
learning_content.content:
kommen → Kommt, bitte! Yani, Baraye mehrbani aye.

warten Wartet auf uns! Yani Humein intezaar kare.

aufhören Hört mit dem Reden, yani baten karna band kare.

learning_content.title: Ikhtitami Taqreeb
learning_content.content:
Agar aap zyada se zyada logon se formal tariqe se baat kar rahe hain, to aap Sie plural form ka istemal karte hain. Formal imperative singular aur plural ke beech farq nahi karta, yahi wajah hai keh yeh bilkul isi tarah banaya jata hai:

kommen → Kommen Sie, meine Herren. Yani, Sajjanon, baraye mehrbani aye.

warten Warten Sie! Yani, Intezaar Karein!

eintreten Bitte treten Sie ein. Yani, Baraye mehrbani andar ayein.

learning_content.title: Zuban Ka Pehla Muqam
learning_content.content: Jaisa keh aap ne dekha hai, German ke tamam imperative forms ek important feature rakhte hain: verb sentence me pehle position per hota hai. Yeh structure English se bohat milta julta hai.

learning_content.title: Dastaviqi Nishan
learning_content.content: Likhri German me, aap command form ke bad aksar an exclamation mark lagate hain. Is se command form me takhleeq ki gayi baat per zyada zor dalta hai.

learning_content.title: Aksariyat Ka Istemal
learning_content.content: German me imperative kaafi frequently use hota hai. Is ka istemal batameezi ya rudeness nahi hota. English isi tarah ke structures ka zyada istemal karti hai, aksar sawal me.

learning_content.title: Form, jab kisi sey kuch karne ke liye pucha jata hai
learning_content.content: 'Kya aap khidki khol sakte hain, baraye meherbani?' Yeh baat yaad rakhen ke German zaban men aksar isi tarah ke jumle use hote hain, lekin kuch waqt ke liye imperatives ke liye tayyar rahen.

learning_content.title: Advice dena apne close friend ko unke health ke baray men
learning_content.content:
Aap apne kareebi dost ko uski sehat ke bare mein mashwara de rahe hain. Niche diye gaye sentences ko command form mein likhen, lekin du form ka istemal karen.
for example: mehr Zeit für sich selber / haben → Hab mehr Zeit für dich selber!

learning_content.title: Exercise 6.4
learning_content.content:
Baraye mashq karne ke liye, niche die gae jumle ko translate karen. Pehle German ke Sie form me, phir du form aur akhir mein ihr form me.
1. Braaye meherbani shuru karain.
2. Khirki kholen.
3. Kya aap mujhe bill la sakten hain, braaye meherbani.
4. Hoshiyar rahen.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. German me kitne mukhtalif command shapes hote hain?
2. Aap kaise singular informal command banatay hain?
3. Kya normal verb variations command formation me apply hoti hain?
4. Aap kaise formal command ko pehchante hain?

learning_content.title: Unit 6
learning_content.content: Yeh unit number 35 hai.

learning_content.title: Do Qisam Ke Sawalat
learning_content.content: Mukhtalif qisam ke sawalaat hote hain. Pehla woh hota hai jo sawaal lafz (interrogative) se shuru hota hai aur zyada ‘kholta’ hai. Doosra woh hota hai jo aik mukammal fiel se shuru hota hai aur ‘han’ ya ‘nahi’ ke jawab ki zaroorat hoti hai. Ye dono qisam ke sawalat English aur German zaban mein aam taur par istemal hote hain.

learning_content.title: Tafseel ke sath Interrogative ya ‘w-questions’
learning_content.content:
Yahan aham sawal lafzon aur un ke English mutaradifat ki fahrist di gai hai:
wer? - who?
was? - what?
wo? - where?
woher? - where . . . from?
wohin? - where . . . (to)?
Interrogative sawalaat jaise ke, ‘Aap kahan se aaye hain?’ aur ‘Aap kahan rehte hain?’

learning_content.title: Han Ya Nahi Ka Sawal
learning_content.content: Is qisam ke sawalaat jaise ke, ‘Kya aap ke paas behen bhai hain?’ aur ‘Kya yeh aap ka mobile hai?’

learning_content.title: Jab tumhara naam kiya hai?
learning_content.content:
German Bei sawal karte hue 'wie' istemal hota hai jab hum kisi ka naam ya address pochte hain. English mein iski tarjuma 'how' hoti hai lekin yahan pe iska matlab 'what' hota hai.

Misal ke taur pe:

Wie ist dein Name? yani 'tumhara naam kiya hai?'

'was' istemal karna galat hoga is situation mein.

learning_content.title: wo, wohin aur woher ka istemal
learning_content.content: German mein 'wo' ka matlab 'where' hota hai. Agar hum kisi jagah ki taraf ya uss se hatne ki bat kar rahe hain to hum 'wohin' ya 'woher' istemal karte hain.

learning_content.title: Misaalein
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch misaal di gai hain jo yeh batati hain ki sawal karne wale lafzon ka istemal kis tarah hota hai.

Wer ist das? yani 'wo kon hai?'

Wo wohnst du? yani 'tum kahan rehte ho'

Woher kommen Sie? yani 'aap kahan se aaye hain'

Wohin fährt Juliane nächstes Wochenende? yani 'Juliane agle hafte kahan ja rahi hai'

Wie ist deine E-Mail-Adresse? yani 'tumhari E-mail id kya hai?'

Wie viel kosten 100 Gramm Mozzarella? yani '100 gram Mozzarella ki kimat kya hai?'

Wie oft gehst du aus? yani 'tum kitni bar bahar jate ho?'

learning_content.title: Jaga aur Muqam
learning_content.content: 'Jahan hai church?' ya 'Aap kahan ja rahe hain is sham?' jaise sawalat kaise poochte hain. Aise hi, 'Aap kahan se aa rahe hain?' iss bare main bhi janain ge.

learning_content.title: Pesha aur Kaam ki Jagah
learning_content.content: 'Aap kiya karte hain zindagi main?' dosre lafzon main 'Aap ka pesha kiya hai?' kaise poochtay hain. Agar aap janna chahta hain k koi konse compani main kam karta hai to german main aap aise sawaal puchtay hain: 'Aap kaha kam kartay hain?' ya phir 'Aap kiskay liye kam kartay hain?'

learning_content.title: Sawal k Alfaz Pehle Position main
learning_content.content:
Sawal ka lafz sawal main pehle position pe hota hai. Ye alf finite verb ke sath dosri idea ka part hota hai, phir subject ata hai.
For example: 'Kahan se aaye ho?' ya phir 'Juliane weekend pe kahan jayegi?'

learning_content.title: Haan aur Naah wale Sawalat Detail main
learning_content.content: Dosre type ke sawal ka jawab sirf 'Haan' ya 'Naah' hota hai. Jaisa ke aap dekh sakte hain, iss main koi sawal lafz nahi hota. Balkay finite verb pehli position main hota hai. For example: 'Kya Peter Berlin se aata hai?' ya 'Kya aap Hotel 'Zur Sonne' main rehtay hain?' ya 'Kya tum pasand kartay ho peenay ko?'

learning_content.title: Farq between English and German Questions
learning_content.content:
German is much simpler than English in this respect.English often uses the verb ‘do’ to form this kind of question: ‘Does Peter come from Berlin?’ ‘Do you stay in the hotel “Zur Sonne”?’ ‘Do you like drinking?’
In German, these structures do not exist. It is suﬃcient to move the ﬁnite verb to the beginning of the sentence. Here are some more examples:
Do you speak German?
Does he work for MTV Germany?
Does she really run 10 km each day?

learning_content.title: Exercise 7.3
learning_content.content:
Ye angrezi moujooda sawalat ko roman urdu mai translate karien. Aap 'you' k liye 'du' aur 'Sie' dono forms ka istemaal karien.


  1. Tumhara naam kya hai?
  2. Tum kahan se ho?
  3. Tumhara e-mail address kya hai?
  4. Abhi time kya hai?
  5. Kiya tum shadi shuda ho?
  6. Kiya tumhein bachay hain?
  7. Kiya tum angrezi bolte ho?

learning_content.title: Question Word Usage
learning_content.content:
1 Ap kaun sa sawaal lafz istemaal karte hain jab aap naam ya pata ke liye poochte hain?
2 Aap yes or no question mein finite verb ko kahan rakhenge?
3 Aap 'w-question' mein finite verb ko kahan rakhenge?

learning_content.title: Describing Directions
learning_content.content: 4 Agar aap kisi ko kisi jagah se aa rahe ya kisi manzil ko ja rahe hain describe karna chahte hain, to aapko konse sawaal lafze istemaal karne ki zaroorat hoti hai?

learning_content.title: Noun kya hai?
learning_content.content: A noun ek lafz hota hai jiska istemal insaan ya cheez ko naam dene ke liye hota hai, ek aala ya khayal: a woman, a boat, friendship, democracy. Bohot sari zubanein hain jinmein nouns kisi na kisi gender mein hote hain - yeh masculine, feminine ya neuter ho sakte hain.

learning_content.title: English mein Biological gender
learning_content.content: English zuban mein, nouns ki gender unki avastha ke hisab se hoti hai: cheezein, objects, janwar aur khayalat neuter ('it') hoti hain, female vyakti feminine ('she') hote hain aur male vyakti masculine ('he') hote hain. Is tarah se nouns ko classify karne ko 'biological' gender kaha ja sakta hai. German zuban mein iska istemaal grammatical gender ke liye kiya gaya hai, jismein koi aysi rishta nahi hota hai.

learning_content.title: German mein teen genders
learning_content.content:
German zuban mein, saare nouns masculine, feminine ya neuter hote hain. Inhe pehchanna mumkin hota hai definite article ('the' in English) se, jo har ek gender ke liye alg hota hai: der masculine ke liye hota hai, die female ke liye aur das neuter ke liye:


Masculine: der (misal: der Mann, der Tisch) yani, the man, the table
Feminine: die (misal: die Frau, die Tür) yani, the woman, the door
Neuter: das (misal: das Kind, das Fenster) yani, the child, the window

note kare ki plural mein in teeno groups ka same article hota hai: die Männer ‘the men’, die Frauen ‘the women’, die Kinder 'the children'.

learning_content.title: Germanski nouns ki Gender
learning_content.content: Jaisa ke aap dekh sakte hain, woh nouns jinka natural gender wazeh hota hai, unka gender guess karna asaan hota hai: der Mann mard hai aur die Frau aurat. Lekin afsos ke saath, aksar nouns ki gender samajhna mushkil hota hai. Germanski words 'table', 'door' aur 'window' ke liye, misal ke taur par, tamam mukhtalif groups se taluk rakhte hain. Yeh pasand karna behtar hai ke aap naye noun ko uski gender ke saath seekhen: der Tisch, die Tür, das Fenster.

learning_content.title: Noun ki gender kaisey dhundhein
learning_content.content: Aam taur per, aik dictionary mein noun ki gender word ke baad di jati hai. Sab se aam mukhtasirat hain: m (masculine), f (feminine), nt (neuter). Phir bhi, kuch aesay ishare bhi hain jo aap ko samajhne mein madadgar sabit ho sakte hain ke noun mardana, aurat ya phir neutral hai. Aik ishara noun ke end mein ane wala hai. Kuch aisay groups bhi hain jin mein tamam nouns ki genders same hain. Yaha ek overview hai.

learning_content.title: Masculine nouns ke liye clues
learning_content.content:
Zaroori endings:

Jab aap noun ke end pe ye endings dekhein, iska matlab hai ke noun mardana hai:

-er, misal ke tor par, der Computer, der Wecker (computer, alarm clock)

-ig, misal ke tor par, der Honig, der Käfig (honey, cage)

-ismus, misal ke tor par, der Idealismus, der Kapitalismus (idealism, capitalism)

-ling, misal ke tor par, der Frühling, der Schilling (spring, shilling)

-or, misal ke tor par, der Motor, der Reaktor (engine, reactor)

Groups of nouns:

Aisay bhi kuch groups hain jo mardana hain:

Male persons, misal ke tor par, der Vater, der Sohn (father, son)

Names of days and months, misal ke tor par, der Montag, der August (Monday, August)

Names of seasons, misal ke tor par, der Sommer, der Winter (summer, winter)

Makes of cars, misal ke tor par, der BMW, der Jaguar (BMW, Jaguar)

Alcoholic drinks, misal ke tor par, der Whisky, der Wein (whisky, wine)

'Beer' ek exception hai aur neuter hai: das Bier

learning_content.title: Clues for feminine nouns
learning_content.content:
Yeh ending aksar indicate karti hain k noun feminine hai:
Yeh bhi note karen k taqreeban 90% nouns jo -e se khatam hotay hain wo feminine hotay hain: die Adresse yani 'address', die Flasche yani 'bottle', die Krawatte yani 'tie'
Lekin kuch ahem istisna hain jaise k der Name yani 'name' aur der Käse yani 'cheese'.
Kuch aise nouns bhi hain jo feminine hotay hain:
Mashoor istisnayen hain: das Mädchen yani ‘girl’, das Veilchen yani ‘violet’.

learning_content.title: Clues for neuter nouns
learning_content.content:
Doosray do genders ki tarhan, kuch khaas endings aapko yeh batati hain k noun neuter hai. Sabse ahem hain:
-ei
die Bäckerei, die Türkei
Yani bakery, Turkey
Aur isi tarah ki kuch aur istisnaen hain. Neeche diye gye hain:
-enz, -heit, -ie, -ion, -keit, -tät, -schaft, -ung, -ur
Aur female persons, names of motorbikes and ships, names of trees and flowers.

learning_content.title: Nouns Capitalization
learning_content.content:
Yaad rakhain ke German mai har noun koi capital letter se shuru hota hai:

Der Computer hat eine neue (The computer has a new)

Tastatur. (keyboard.)

Wie heißt das Kino? (What is the name of the cinema?)

Ye aapko madad kar sakta hai German sentence mai noun ko dhundne mai.

learning_content.title: Compound Nouns
learning_content.content:
Aapne dekha hoga ke German bolne wale log lambay alfazon ka istamal pasand karte hain. Grammar ke terms mai ek word jo se ziada se ziada nouns se muntaqil hota hai, use compound noun kehte hain. Is case mai last noun gender ko define kartha hai:

de Wein + die Flasche = > die Weinﬂasche (wine bottle)

das Telefon + die Nummer = das Telefonnummer (telephone number)

der Computer + das Spiel = das Computerspiel (computer game)

learning_content.title: Types of Nouns
learning_content.content:
Kuch khaas type ke nouns bhi hote hain:

-chen das Mädchen, das Märchen (girl, fairy tale)

-lein das Fräulein, das Männlein (Miss, little man)

-ma das Klima, das Thema (climate, theme/topic)

-ment das Dokument, das Instrument (document, instrument)

-o das Kino, das Büro (cinema, office)

-um das Album, das Zentrum (album, centre)

Young persons das Baby, das Kind (baby, child)

Infinitives used as nouns das Singen, das Tanzen (singing, dancing)

Names of most metals das Silber, das Gold (silver, gold)

learning_content.title: Moarif Aar Maqarir
learning_content.content: Ap phle hi dekh chuke hain keh tehqiqi aar moarif teen mukhtalif wahid hote hain: der, die and das. Jamid sab dee hain.

learning_content.title: Ghair Moarif Maqarir
learning_content.content: Ghair moarif maqarir (Jo English mai ‘a’ hota hai) muzakkar naam lye 'ein', moannis naam lye 'eine' or munsalik naam lye phir 'ein' hota hai.

learning_content.title: Maqarir tabdeel hosakte hain
learning_content.content: Zyada pechida dhanchon mein, dono moarif aur ghair moarif aar maqarir thore se badal sakte hain. Mazeed malomat ke liye, units 10–14 dekhein.

learning_content.title: Ahem Nishandahi ka Khulasa
learning_content.content: Ye aik khulasa hai jo ahem isharat ka kaam deti hai, keh German mai naun ka jins kesay pechan sakte hain. Masculine '(jins muzakar) ein, Feminine (jins maada) eine Neuter (jins munsalik) ein'

learning_content.title: Exercise 8.4
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences.


1 Ferrari bohat tez hai.

2 Mez aur khirki tooti hui hai.

3 Beti ka naam Marianna hai.

4 Akhbar bohat mehnga hai.

5 Gulab bohat khubsurat hai.

6 Cinema band hai. (closed = geschlossen)

7 Football team buri hai.

8 Beer ki qeemat 2 euro hai.

9 Sheher ke markaz bohat purana hai.

10 Kya computer naya hai?

11 Larki paanch saal ki hai aur larka saat saal ka hai.

12 Cheese France se hai.

learning_content.title: Kyun gender German ki taleem kay liye itna important hai? Grammatical gender ka kya matlab hai?
learning_content.content: Ye samajhna bohat zaroori hai kyun gender German language kay liye itna important hai. Grammatical gender ka matlab yeh hota hai kih German language main har noun ka aik gender hota hai jo masculine, feminine ya neuter ho sakta hai.

learning_content.title: Kya aap masculine, feminine, neuter nouns kay liye deﬁnite and indeﬁnite articles pesh kar saktay hain?
learning_content.content: German zabaan main har noun ya toh masculine, feminine ya neuter hota hai. In sab ki apni definite aur indefinite articles hoti hain. Yeh samajhna zaroori hai kyun kih yeh articles German grammar ka aham hissa hain.

learning_content.title: Konse indicators yeh wazahat kartay hain kih aik noun masculine, feminine, neuter hai?
learning_content.content: Nouns kih gender ko identify karnay ka aik tariqah yeh hai kih aap noun kih ending par nazar dalain. Mukhtalif genders ki mukhtalif endings hoti hain.

learning_content.title: Kya aap wo categories list kar saktay hain jis main nouns aam taur par masculine, feminine, neuter hotay hain?
learning_content.content: German zabaan main kuch specific rules hain jin ki base par nouns ko unki gender milti hai. In rules ki samajh bohat zaroori hai.

learning_content.title: German nouns ki spelling kis tarah distinctive hai?
learning_content.content: German nouns ki spelling unki uniqueness aur distinctiveness ka sabab hoti hai. Har noun ki spelling uski gender aur meaning ko represent karti hai.

learning_content.title: Plural of nouns
learning_content.content: Jab nouns sirf aik item ki taraf reference kartay hain, to grammatically woh singular form ma hotay hain. Agar aap ek se zyada item ke baare me baat kar rahe hain to aap plural ka istemaal kartay hain.

learning_content.title: Plurals in English
learning_content.content:
English me, nouns kay plural forms banana relatively asaan hota hai - aam taur par sirf '-s' shamil kiya jata hai:

'a cigarette' → 'two cigarettes', 'a house' → 'ﬁve houses'.

Exceptions include: 'a woman' → 'two women', 'a child' → 'three children'.

learning_content.title: Patterns in German
learning_content.content:
German kay pas plural forms banana kay liye kai tareeqay hotay hain. Is liye ya mashwara hai kay jab ek nai word seekhain to us ka plural form bhi seekhain.

But as with gender there are patterns for typical endings, or plural formations for masculine, feminine and neuter nouns.

Here is an overview.

learning_content.title: Clues for masculine nouns
learning_content.content: Adding -e The great majority of masculine nouns form their plural by just adding -e:

learning_content.title: Noun Endings: -er, -el or -en
learning_content.content: Noun jo -er, -el ya -en khatam hotay hain, in mein aksar koi tabdeeli nahi hoti hai ya kabhi kabhi umlaut shaamil hota hai. Yaad rakhein, ye sirf hidayaat hain, kuchh ajeeb iktitafat hain jaisa ke der Mann → die Männer.

learning_content.title: Feminine Noun Indications
learning_content.content: -n ya -en ka izafa. Aksar khawateen ke naam -n ya -en ka izafa karti hain:

learning_content.title: Umlaut + -e Ending
learning_content.content: Kuch aam istemal kiye jane wale female nouns mein Umlaut: + -e ka izafa hota hai. Misal ke liye: der Beruf (job) → die Berufe (jobs), der Film (film) → die Filme (films), der Tisch (table) → die Tische (tables)

learning_content.title: Nouns with no ending or just umlaut
learning_content.content: Kuch nouns khatam nahi hotay hain ya sirf umlaut hotay hain. Misal ke liye: der Kuchen (cake) → die Kuchen (cakes), der Apfel (apple) → die Äpfel (apples)

learning_content.title: Noun endings: -n or -en
learning_content.content: Bohat saray noun -n ya -en khatam hotay hain. Misal ke liye: die Frau (woman) → die Frauen (women), die Zeitung (newspaper) → die Zeitungen (newspapers), die Tasse (cup) → die Tassen (cups), die Sprache (language) → die Sprachen (languages)

learning_content.title: Noun endings: -e + umlaut
learning_content.content: Kuch nouns -e + umlaut k sath khatam hotay hain. Misal ke liye: die Hand (hand) → die Hände (hands), die Stadt (city) → die Städte (cities)

learning_content.title: Neuter nouns: Adding -e
learning_content.content: Aksariyat neuter nouns mein humein -e jodna parta hai magar koi umlaut nahi:  - das Bein (tang) ban jata hai die Beine (tangain) mein end hone wala '-e' - das Haar (baal) ban jata hai die Haare (baal) mein '-e' end hone wala - das Jahr (saal) ban jata hai die Jahre (saal) mein '-e' end hone wala

learning_content.title: Neuter nouns: Adding umlaut + -er
learning_content.content: Aik aam ending '-er' hoti hai, jahan asal stem vowel mein a, o, ya u hota hai:  - das Kind (bacha) ban jata hai die Kinder (bachay) mein '-er' end hone wala - das Buch (kitab) ban jati hai die Bücher (kitaben) mein, jahan umlaut + '-er' hai

learning_content.title: Nouns ending in -chen or -lein
learning_content.content: Nouns jo '-chen' ya '-lein' pe khatam hote hain, plural mein un mein koi tabdeeli nahi ati:  - das Mädchen (ladki) ban jati hai die Mädchen (ladkian) mein, jahan koi ending nahi hoti

learning_content.title: Foreign words
learning_content.content: Jin foreign words ko German mein English ya French se 'import' kiya gaya hota hai, un mein aam tor pe '-s' add hota hai:  - der Chef (boss) ban jata hai die Chefs (bosses) mein - die Party (party) ban jati hai die Partys (parties) mein - das Team (team) ban jati hai die Teams (teams) mein

learning_content.title: Taraash plural Dictionary se
learning_content.content:
Agar aap ko aik noun ka plural form nahin maloom, aap dictionary mein isko talashi sakty hain. Plural form aam tor per teesry number per diya jata hai, jo gender aur noun ka genitive ending k baad ata hai:


Beruf m, -(e)s, -e occupation, job → Yahan plural diya gaya hai -e: Berufe


Reise f, -, -n journey, trip → Yahan plural diya gaya hai -n: Reisen

learning_content.title: Plural mein Umelaut ki Zarorat
learning_content.content:
Agar aap noun ki ending dekh rahy hain or wahan -¨ diya hua hai, iska matlab hai k aik umlaut ki zarorat hai.
Vater m, -s, -¨ father → Is liye plural Väter hona chahye.
Kuch cases mein umlaut k sath sath dosri ending bhi chahye hoti hai: Hand f, -, -¨e hand → Yahan apko umlaut or -e dono add karne parenge: Hand turns into Hände

learning_content.title: Yaad Rekhne waly Points
learning_content.content:
Yahan most common plural noun endings ka aik summary hai:
-e
-er (+ umlaut)
-n or -en
-s
koi ending nahi
Nouns jin k endings -chen or -lein hain: das Mädchen → die Mädchen
Nouns jinhon ne -el, -en, -er k sath endings: der Spiegel → die Spiegel
Aksar woh umlaut add karte hain: der Vater → die Väter

learning_content.title: Mashq 9.1
learning_content.content: Diye gaye maloomat ka istemal karte hue, darj zeel ismin jama banaen. Pehla aap ke liye kar diya gaya hai

learning_content.title: Mashq 9.2
learning_content.content: Darj zeel ismin jama dijiye. Misal ke taur par: die Flasche → die Flaschen

learning_content.title: Char Cases
learning_content.content: Ye Unit app ko German ke basic rules par aik mukhtasir jaiza denay ki koshish karay ga jin ka talluq cases se hai. Unit 11-14 har case ko detail main samjhaen ge aur examples aur exercises den ge.

learning_content.title: Cases kia hain?
learning_content.content: Nouns (jaisa ke 'aadmi', 'ghar', 'kutta') aik sentence main mukhtalif kirdar ada kartay hain. Misal ke taur par, aik noun jo ho raha hai us ka agent ho sakta hai ( 'Dog bites man') ya phir woh position main ho sakta hai jahan verb ka action us par ho ( 'Dog bites man'). German main, ye mukhtalif kirdar case ke zariye signal kiye jatay hain. Mukhtalif cases ko endings main dikhaya jata hai.

learning_content.title: Ye English se kaise muqabla karta hai?
learning_content.content:
English main, noun ye mukhtalif kirdar sentence main ada karta hai. Aap jante hain ke aik noun tab subject hota hai jab woh verb se pehle ata hai. Agar yeh object hai, toh woh verb ke bad ata hai. Lekin aam tor par case zahir nahi hota, siwaye jab aap pronouns use karte hain: 'he'/'she’/'it' etc.:
Peter loves Mary.
He loves her.
Mary loves Peter.
She loves him.

learning_content.title: German main char cases
learning_content.content: German main char mukhtalif cases hain. Har case ko sentence ke aik khas kirdar, ya 'function', se jora ja sakta hai.

learning_content.title: Nominative Case
learning_content.content:
Nominative case tab use hota hai jab kisi noun ko sentence ka subject banaya jata hai, yani ki jo 'action' ho raha hai uska 'agent' ('Kon kar raha hai action?'):

The man is reading. (Mard padh raha hai.)

learning_content.title: Accusative Case
learning_content.content:
Jab koi noun sentence main direct object ban jata hai, yaani 'action' ka 'receiver', to German main normally accusative case use hota hai ('Kin ya kya par asar kar raha hai action?'):

Der Mann liest einen Roman. (Mard ek novel padh raha hai.)

learning_content.title: Dative Case
learning_content.content:
Dative case tab istemal hota hai jab kisi verb ke saat ek second object bhi ho, matlab indirect object ('Kis ke liye, ya kiske liye kia jaa raha hai action?').

Der Mann gibt der Frau einen Roman. (Mard aurat ko novel de raha hai.)

learning_content.title: Genitive Case
learning_content.content:
Genitive case tab use hota hai jab do noun ke beech ka rishta batana ho. Ye batata hai ki ek cheez dusri ke 'belongs' hai.

Der Hut des Mannes. (Mard ka topi.)

learning_content.title: Why are cases important?
learning_content.content: Cases decide karte hain ki definite articles ('the' – der, die, das), indefinite articles ('a' – ein, eine, ein) aur nouns ke saath linked words ke endings kya honge (Units 11–14 ke liye aur dekhen). Dekhiye ek quick overview ki kis tarah se ye chaar cases affect karte hain indefinite article aur the definite article.

learning_content.title: The indefinite article
learning_content.content:
Nominative, Accusative, Dative, Genitive

Masculine: ein, einen, einem, eines

Feminine: eine, eine, einer, einer

Neuter: ein, ein, einem, eines

learning_content.title: Faktors jinhain case tayyar kar rahe hain
learning_content.content:
Case tayyar karne ke liye teen faktors hote hain. Hum ne un mein se aik ko upar wazeh kiya hai: case noun ka role tay karta hai jo sentence mein play kar raha hota hai; kya yeh subject hai ya object?


Do aur factors hain, jo decide karte hain ki kis case ka use hona chahiye: verb, aur sentence mein prepositions.

learning_content.title: Verbs
learning_content.content:
Verb muktasir ke case ko tay karti hain:


  • Zyadatar verbs accusative ki zaroorat hoti hai.

  • Kuch specific verbs hamesha dative ki zaroorat hoti hain (jaise, helfen ‘to help’ ya gehören ‘to belong’).

  • Bohot kam verbs genitive case ko leti hain.

Agar aapke pass aik verb hai jo dative case ki zaroorat hoti hai, to German sentence mein object ko dative mein hi rakha jata hai, bhale hi yeh English mein direct object ho:


Der Mann hilft der Frau.


The man helps the woman.


German mein, 'the woman' dative case (der Frau) mein hota hai kyunke helfen wo verb hai jis ke baad aapko hamesha dative use karna hota hai.

learning_content.title: Prepositions
learning_content.content:
German mein prepositions (jaise English mein ‘at’, ‘on’, ‘to’, ‘for’) aik specific case ki zaroorat hoti hai.


nominative accusative dative genitive
der (mardana) den (mardana) dem (mardana) des (mardana)
die (khawateen) die (khawateen) der (khawateen) der (khawateen)
das (neuter) das (neuter) dem (neuter) des (neuter)

learning_content.title: Grammar Principle: Case usage in Prepositions
learning_content.content:
Kuch prepositions accusative ko consider kartay hain (for example 'durch' which means 'through' ya 'für' which means 'for').

Kuch prepositions dative ko consider kartay hain (for example 'mit' which means 'with' or 'von' which means 'from').

Genitive ko consider karnay wali Prepositions buhat kam hoti hain.

learning_content.title: Accusative Case Example
learning_content.content:
Agar apki pas koi aisi preposition hai jo accusative case ko consider karti hai, toh German sentence mei object must be accusative, kahin wo English mai indirect object kyun na ho.

Example: 'Ich kaufe einen Roman für meinen Freund'. English translation would be 'I’m buying a novel for my friend'.

English mai, 'for my friend' indirect object hain, but in German 'für meinen Freund' accusative case mai hota hai because 'für' einnek esi preposition hai jiske baad accusative case ko consider karna padhta hai.

learning_content.title: Summary of Basic Principles
learning_content.content:
Cases ka use teen principles par tay hota hai:

  1. Whether the noun is the subject or the object of the sentence,
  2. The verb, and
  3. Any prepositions used.

Yeh khasi ahmiyat rakhta hai ke aap yeh sekhen ke konse verbs dative leti hain or konse prepositions konse case ko govern karti hain.

learning_content.title: Mashq 10.2
learning_content.content: Mashq 10.2 main aapko mukhtalif sets of sentences deya gaya hain. Aapko in sentences se objects identify karne hain aur unhen 1 aur 2 main number karna hain. Kya aap yeh samajh sakte hain ke kon sa object accusative case main hai aur kon sa dative case main? Aap oper diye gaye tables ko check kar sakte hain endings ke liye.  Misal ke toor pe, 'Sie gibt dem Mann eine Zigarette.' main, 'dem Mann' (1), aur 'eine Zigarette' (2) hain.  (1) 'dem Mann' dative case main hote hain (ise kuch dia ja raha hai)  (2) 'eine Zigarette' accusative case main hota hai.

learning_content.title: Mashq 10.3
learning_content.content: Neeche diye gaye dono tables main aapko wo endings ke against tick lagana hai jo nominative se different hain. Aapko har ek ke liye ek example diya gaya hai.  Mutaen shay: accusative dative genitive masculine einen einem eines feminine eine einer einer neuter ein einem eines  Makhsos shay: accusative dative genitive masculine den dem des feminine die der der neuter das dem des.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. Kitne asool German k cases ko govern karte han?
2. Kya aap inn principles ko provide kar sakty han?
3. Aap kon sa case subject k liye use karte han?
4. Aap normally kon sa case direct object k liye use karte han?
5. Aap normally kon sa case indirect object k liye use karte han?
6. Kon si words ya words k parts change hojate han jab aap different cases use karte han?
7. Kab ek 'indirect' object accusative case me hota hai?
8. Kab ek 'direct' object dative case me hota hai?

learning_content.title: Nominative case kiya hai?
learning_content.content: German mein nominative case ka istemal tab hota hai jab noun subject hota hai sentence mein - yani koi shakhs ya cheez jo koi kaam kar rahi ho.

learning_content.title: Nominative case ke misal
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch misalon mein nouns nominative case mein diye gaye hain:

  • Der Mann hört Musik. - Aadmi music sun raha hai.
  • Die Frau liest das Buch. - Aurat kitab parh rahi hai.
  • Das Kind kauft einen Apfel. - Bacha seb khareed raha hai.
  • Die Gäste wollen es nicht. - Mehman isey nahi chahte.

learning_content.title: Nominative case mein endings
learning_content.content: Jaisa ke Unit 10 mein bataya gaya tha, cases German mein ahem hain kyun ke wo nouns se jure alag alag alfaz ke endings par asar dalte hain. Yahan sabse aam endings ka jayeza diya gaya hai:

learning_content.title: Sein aur werden ke baad nominative case
learning_content.content: Sein 'to be' aur werden 'to become' ke baad bhi nominative case ka istemal hota hai:

learning_content.title: Modiﬁer
learning_content.content:
• Mard - der Mann
  • Aurat - die Frau
  • Bache - das Kind
  • Mehman - die Gäste

learning_content.title: Muayaan articles
learning_content.content:
• ein Mann - aik mard
  • eine Frau - aik aurat
  • ein Kind - aik bacha
  • Gäste - mehman

learning_content.title: Manfi article
learning_content.content:
• kein Mann - koi mard nahi
  • keine Frau - koi aurat nahi
  • kein Kind - koi bacha nahi
  • keine Gäste - koi mehman nahi

learning_content.title: Possessive
learning_content.content:
• mein Mann - mera mard
  • meine Frau - meri aurat
  • mein Kind - meri bacha
  • meine Gäste - mere mehman

learning_content.title: Jumla formation
learning_content.content: Woh aik dilchasp insan hai. Yeh aik acha din hoga. Lekin yeh hamesha wazeh nahi hota, kyun ke aap kabhi kabhi German mein in verbs ke sath unmei aur indefinite article ka istemal nahi kartey. Woh aik engineer hai. Woh aik ustaad banney wali hai.

learning_content.title: How to spot the nominative case
learning_content.content:
Muzo hamesha jumla ki shuruaat par nahi hota:
Kal class Berlin ja rahi hai.
Khana khaney ke baad, woh ek espresso peeta hai.
Aik asan tareeka yeh hai ke jumla ka muzo talash karne ke liye 'Kaun ya kya kar raha hai?' pooche. Kal kon Berlin ja raha hai? Class. Kaun Espresso pee raha hai? Woh pee raha hai.

learning_content.title: Exercise 11.3
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences.

1 Yeh aik ghar hai.
2 Ghar bohat purana hai.
3 Admi ka naam Mario hai.
4 Woh aik engineer hai.
5 Akhbar bohat dilchasp hai.
6 Aldi Germany mein aik supermarket hai.
7 Bache kon hain?

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1 Jab noun nominative case mein hota hai toh iska sentence mein kya kaam hota hai?
2 Kaunse do verbs ke baad aap nominative use karte hain?
3 Kaise aap sentence mein subject ko spot kar sakte hain?

learning_content.title: Quboolia Surat (The accusative case)
learning_content.content:
German adat ke mutabiq, jab ism moa'ni maf'ool banta hai, yani jumla mei'amal ka markaz banta hai, to hum Quboolia case istemaal karte hai. Misal ke taur par,

Der Mann kauft den Computer. (mard computer khareedta hai.

Muzakar istilaahat mei tabdeelian aa jati hain. Quboolia case me, muzakar nouns ke liye moarif (jaise der, yar aik dia gaya article) taqseem karte hain: • der ko den bana dia jata hai or • aik ko einen bana dia jata hai. Jabkay ma'annas, khasiya tammaz, Jama' Mazi mei koi tabdeelian aati hi nahi.

learning_content.title: Quboolia Case mei Izafiyat (Endings in the accusative case)
learning_content.content:
Yahan aam moarifat ke Quboolia Izafiyat ka jaiza hai:

Jaisa ke aap dekh sakte hain, tamam muzakar moarifat ki izafiyat -en hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Moarifat (Modifiers)
learning_content.content:
Moarif (Modifier)Muzakar (Masculine) Ma'annas (Feminine) Khasiya tammaz (Neuter) Jama' Mazi (Plural)
Moarif Haqiqi (Definite articles) den Mann die Frau das Kind die Gäste
Moarif Ghair Haqiqi (Indefinite articles) einen Mann eine Frau ein Kind – Gäste
Moarif Manfi (Negative article) keinen Mann keine Frau kein Kind keine Gäste
Hamiati (Possessive) meinen Mann meine Frau mein Kind meine Gäste

unit_name: Unit 12: Accusative Case in German Language

learning_content.title: Accusative Case Usage with Verbs
learning_content.content: Aap accusative case zyadatar verbs k baad use kartay hain. Darasal, German verbs jo aik (direct) object letay hain, accusative case letay hain. Accusative case laynay walay verbs ko hum transitive verbs kehtay hain. Dictionary mein, headword k baad 'vt' ki mukhtasir form hogi jo is ki nishandahi kar rahi hoti hai. Agar aap aik verb daakhilay par aik 'vt' dekhtay hain, toh aap jantay hain k yeh verb accusative case leta hay.

learning_content.title: Accusative Case Usage with Prepositions
learning_content.content:
Aap accusative case kuch prepositions k baad bhi istemal kartay hain. Mandarjah zel prepositions hamesha accusative case laytay hain:
ohne without
um around, at
Ta'luq bananay k liye, ye misalain samajhain:
Hum abhi aik surang k zariye guzar rahay hain.
Kya aap is company k liye kaam kartay hain?Woh is offer k khilaf hain.

learning_content.title: Examples of Accusative Case Usage
learning_content.content:
Nominative - Accusative
der Stuhl - Mein Stuhl khareed raha hoon.
die CD - Woh CD sunn raha hai.
das Auto - Kya aap car drive karte hain?
ein Regenschirm (m) - Mere paas aik chhatri hai.
eine Cola (f) - Mein aik Coca Cola lun ga.
ein Bier (n) - Woh aik beer pi rahi hai.
der Hunger - Mujhe bhook nahi hai.
ihr Bruder (m) - Woh apnay bhai ki yaad kar rahi hai.

learning_content.title: Accusative case ka istimal
learning_content.content:
Accusative case zyada tar direct object k liye istimal kiya jata hai sentence me. Lekin ye verb ya certain prepositions k upar bhi depend karta hai. Yani k aik sentence me 1 se zyada accusative form ho saktay hain.

Na bholain k, feminine, neuter, aur plural nouns k sath, modifier k endings accusative me change nahi hoti aur wohi rehti hain jaisi k nominative me hoti hain.

learning_content.title: Zyada se zyada ek accusative sentence me
learning_content.content: Jaisa k upar samjhaya gaya hai, accusative case ka use sirf noun k position pe depend nahi hota jaisa k English me direct object hota hai. Accusative case ka use verb aur kuch prepositions k upar bhi depend hota hai. Yani k ek sentence me zyada se zyada ek accusative form bhi ho sakta hai.

learning_content.title: Accusative case – Asal points
learning_content.content: Accusative case zyada tar direct object k liye sentence me istimal hota hai. Lekin is ka use verb aur kuch prepositions k upar bhi determine hota hai.

learning_content.title: Checklist Queries
learning_content.content:
1. Kab aap accusative case ka istemal kartay ho?
  2. Kya accusative case main tamam nouns k liye modifier endings change ho sakti hain?
  3. Lughat main aap kese maloom karain gay k verb accusative case lay ga ya nahi?
  4. Kya aap kuch verbs aur prepositions ka naam bata saktay hain jo accusative case require kartay hain?

learning_content.title: Dative Case kiya hai?
learning_content.content: Dative case ka istemal mukhtalif cheezon ya logon k liye kiya jata hai, jin par kuch kia gaya ho. Misal k tor par: 'Der Lehrer gibt der Frau ein Buch' jo k english mein 'The teacher gives the woman a book' hota hai.

learning_content.title: Dative Case mein Tabdeeli
learning_content.content: Dative case mein, modifier (jaise k muarif aitraz, e.g der, ya ghair muarif aitraz, e.g ein) tabdeel hojata hai. Ye har jins k liye lagu hota hai: muzakar, moannis aur khas. Jama mein, aapko -en ya -n bhi shamil karna parta hai.

learning_content.title: Dative Case mein Ikhtitam
learning_content.content:
Yahan, un sabse aam modifiers k liye dative forms ka aik jaiza hai: Yeh yaad rakhain k

  • muzakar aur khas ikhtitamain aik jaisi hoti hain: -em shamil karein
  • moannis ikhtitam k liye -er shamil karein
  • Jama k liye modifier mein -en aur naam mein -en ya -n shamil karein.


ModifierMuzakarMoannisKhasJama
Muarif Aitrazdem Mannder Fraudem Kindden Gästen
Ghair Muarif Aitrazeinem Manneiner Fraueinem Kind– Gästen
Manfi Aitrazkeinem Mannkeiner Fraukeinem Kindkeinen Gästen
Malkiyatmeinem Manndeiner Frauseinem Kindunseren Gästen

learning_content.title: Verbs Jo Dative Case Ke Zaroorat Rakhtay Hain
learning_content.content:
Kuch verbs hain jin k baad hum dative case use kartay hain. Sab se zaroori hain: helfen ‘maddad karna’, danken ‘shukriya adaa karna’, gehören ‘kisi ki milkiyat mein hona’, folgen ‘peecha karna’. Yeh verbs yaad karne ki koshish karen. Iska istemaal check karen:
der Mann - Mein dem Mann ki peecha kar raha hoon (I follow the man).
die Mutter - Bacha Maa ki milaap rakhta hai (The baby resembles the mother).
das Kind - Mein bachay ka shukriya kar raha hoon (I’m thanking the child).
die Gäste - Mein mehmanon ki madad kar raha hoon (I help the guests).

learning_content.title: Dative After Prepositions
learning_content.content:
Kuch prepositions k baad bhi dative ka use hota hai. Yeh hain:
aus: from, out of
außer: apart from
bei: at, near
gegenüber: opposite
mit: with, by (for means of transport)
nach: after, to
seit: since, for
von: from
zu: to
In ki kuch misaalein:
Er kommt aus der Türkei - Woh Turkey se hain (He’s from Turkey)
Außer den Meiers sind alle da - Siwaye Meiers, sab yahan hain (Except for the Meiers, everybody is here)
Ich arbeite bei der Firma Meier - Mai Meier company k liye kaam karta hoon (I work for (the company) Meier)
Er wohnt gegenüber der Kirche - Woh church k muqabil rehta hai (He lives opposite the church)
Ich fahre mit dem Auto - Mai car se jaoun ga (I’ll go by car)
Nach der Arbeit gehe ich einkaufen - Kaam k baad, mai khareedari karne jaoun ga (After work, I’ll go shopping)
Wir fahren zu meiner Freundin - Hum meri dost k ghar ja rahay hain (We’ll go to my girlfriend’s).

unit_name: Zyada se zyada ek dfa muarrikh ki Mojudgi

learning_content.title: Muarykh in a Sentence
learning_content.content:
German main Muarykh fail ya preposition ki waja se hakoomat hoti hai, Ye aam hai ke wo sentence ya clause main se zyada aik baar aa raha ho. Nichay di gai misalain dekhen:
Ich helfe dem Jungen mit seinem Mantel.
I help the boy with his coat.
Sie folgen dem Mann und dann der Frau mit ihren Freunden.
They follow the man and then the woman and her friends.

learning_content.title: Muarykh Case – The main points
learning_content.content:
German language main Muarykh case ka istimal Indirect object ke liye hota hai. Lekin ye kuch khaas failon aur kuch prepositions ke baad aa sakta hai.
Sabhi nominative se mukhtalif hain:
- masculine aur neuter endings hain -em
- feminine endings hain -er
- plural endings hain -en jo modifier ke sath juda hua hota hai aur -en ya -n jo noun ke sath joda hota hai.
For more information on prepositions see Unit 24.
For more information on pronouns see Unit 15.
For dative endings in adjectives see Unit 23.

learning_content.title: Example Sentences
learning_content.content:
1. Wo larki baby ko kitab daiti hai.
2. Paulina bacche ko CD deti hai.
3. Wo dada ko sharaab ki botal deta hai.
4. Wo us aadmi ke peeche hai.
5. Yeh telephone driver ke paas hai.
6. Peter larki madad karta hai.
7. Wo bachon ko football deta hai.

learning_content.title: Teeno ahem cheezain jinhon ne dative case ka use tay kerdia
learning_content.content: Which three factors determine the use of the dative case?

learning_content.title: Kia dative case mein tamam nouns ke modifier endings ko tabdeel karna parta hai?
learning_content.content: Do modiﬁer endings have to change for all nouns in the dative case?

learning_content.title: Kya aap dative case ke liye sabse am modifier endings ka naam bata sakte hain?
learning_content.content: Can you name the dative endings for the most common modiﬁers?

learning_content.title: Dative case mein kia noun ke end par bhi endings hoti hain?
learning_content.content: Are there also endings to the noun itself in the dative case?

learning_content.title: The genitive case
learning_content.content:
Kya hai genitive case? Genitive case zahir karta hai malikiyat ya ownership: Yeh hai mera baap ka bag.

German mai kya mukhtalif hai? English aur German ka istemal bohat mushaba hai. Aik asal farq hai alfaz ka tarteeb. Jahan English mai genitive construction pehle ata hai, wahan German mai wo amooman noun ke bad ata hai. Niche diye gaye misalen dekhen:

learning_content.title: What’s different in German?
learning_content.content:
Das ist die Tasche meines Vaters. Yeh hai mera baap ka bag.

Das ist das Auto meiner Tante. Woh hain meri phuphi ki car.

Das ist das Spielzeug meines Babys. Yeh hai mere bachay ki khilonay.

Das ist die Meinung der Gäste. Woh hai mehmaano ki raye.

Jaisa ke maqool aur dative case, genitive bhi asar dalta hai khatimay pe(for example the indefinite and definite articles).

learning_content.title: Endings in the genitive case
learning_content.content:
Yaha kuch aam khatimay ka jaiza hai genitive case mai:

modifier masculine feminine neuter plural

definite des Mannes der Frau des Kindes der Gäste

indefinite eines Mannes einer Frau eines Kindes –

possessive meines Mannes meiner Frau meines Kindes meiner Gäste

learning_content.title: Jinhen se asalat haasil hoti hai
learning_content.content: Jaisa ke aap dekh sakty hain, maardudhalat mein 'modiﬁers' muzakkar aur jinseeki mukhaalif, khufia aissam mein -es khatam hoti hain aur muanas aur Jamaat (tadaad zyada) aissam -er mein khatam hoti hain.

learning_content.title: Muzakkar aur Jins-e-khufia aissam
learning_content.content: Muzakkar aur Jins-e-khufia aissam aksar choty aissam (jasy ke der Mann → des Mannes) mein -es shamil kar detay hain aur zyada tar do ya do se zyada wazan (hecrat / silsilay) waly aissam mein -s shamil kar detay hain ( jasy ke der Computer → des Computers).

learning_content.title: Muanas ya Jamaat aissam koi khatma nhai letay
learning_content.content: Aissam jo muanas ya jamaat hotay hain, un mein koi khatma nhain hota.

learning_content.title: Koi apostrophe (saf-e-tar) nahi
learning_content.content: Jab muzakkar ya neuter nouns mein 's' shamil kiya jata hai, tab German mein koi apostrophe (saf-e-tar) nahi hota. Jab aap kisi shakhs ke naam ki taraf ishara karte hain, tab bhi yehi baat lagu hoti hai: for example, 'Das ist Peters Buch (Yeh Peter ki kitab hai)'

learning_content.title: Prepositions ke baad Genitive case
learning_content.content:
Kuch prepositions hote hain jinhain Genitive case chahiye hota hai. Zada tar aam ye hote hain: Trotz (bawajud), Während (doran), Wegen (because of), (An)statt (bajaye).

Misaal ke liye, 'Während seiner Zeit' (uske doran ka wakt) aur 'Trotz ihres hohen Alters' (uski umar ke bawajood).

Shuruati satah par in forms ka istemal krna kam hi hota hai, lekin inka ilam hona acha hai.

learning_content.title: Baat cheet ki German
learning_content.content:
Baat cheet ki German mein, genitive ko bara formal aur purana samjha jata hai. Isay replace karne ka aam tariqa 'von + dative' ka istemal hai:

'Das ist das Auto meines Bruders' ko 'Das ist das Auto von meinem Bruder' mein tabdeel kiya jata hai.

unit_name: Unit 14: Zarf-e-Muzßf Ñlaih (Genitive Case) - Asal Nukta

learning_content.title: Zarf-e-Muzßf Ñlaih (Genitive case) samajna
learning_content.content:
Zarf-e-Muzßf Ñlaih do muzakkar aur mu'annis isim (nouns) ke darmiyan milkiyati talluk bayan karta hai. Angrezi aur German bhasha mein istemal bahut milta julta hai, lekin yaad rakhein ki sariniaze (modifiers) ke liye akhirat badal jati hain:

  • -es muzakkar aur alf sifat wale isim ke liye
  • -er zanana aur Jama' (plural) isim ke liye.

Matloba hay ke hazf (neuter) aur muzakkar isim main -(e)s lazim karain.

learning_content.title: Zarf-e-Muzßf Ñlaih (Genitive case) aam misalain aur mashq
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch aam misalain aur mashq kiya gaya hai:

Example: Das ist die neue Freundin meines Vaters.

Misal ki tarjama: Yeh meray walid ka naya dost hai.

learning_content.title: Zaida malumaat ke liye
learning_content.content:
Zaida malumat ke liye harf-e-jar (prepositions) dekhein Unit 24.

Sifaat (pronouns) ke liye Unit 15 dekhein.

Maful bihi (dative) sifat ki akhiriyon ke liye Unit 25 dekhein.
