learning_content.title: Personal pronouns kiya hain?
learning_content.content:
Aik personal pronoun aik lafz hota hai jo noun ki jagha leta hai, aam tor par aik shakhs ya cheez k liye:

Sara aik quiche laye gi. Wo aik quiche laye gi.

Ye aik noun group ya poori phrase ki jagha bhi le sakta hai:

Mere parosi ka ghar chori ho gaya hai. Ye chori ho gaya hai.

learning_content.title: Personal pronouns in German
learning_content.content:
Ye german mai personal pronouns hain:

Jaisa k aap shayad pehle se jaante honge, German mai logon ko address karne k liye mukhtalif modes hote hain. Doston aur bachon k liye du/ihr ka istemal karein, aur jin logon ko aap achi tarah se nahi jaante hain aur jo aap se barhe hain, un k liye polite Sie ka istemal karein.

singularplural
First personich
I
wir
we
Second persondu
you (informal)
ihr
you (informal)
Sie
you (formal)
Sie
you (formal)
Third personer
he
sie
they
sie
she
es
it

learning_content.title: Points to watch out for
learning_content.content:
Verb endings:Aakhir kar verb German mein badaltay hain jaisay subject hota hai. Ye hai aik mukhtasar summary regular verb endings ki.
Spelling for ‘I’ and ‘you’:Yahan note karain ke ich ‘I’ in German is amooman spelled with a lower-case i jab ye sentence ke aagay nahi hota. Formal ‘you’ Sie dosray hath par hamesha capital letter se start hota hai.
Pronouns in German use the grammatical gender:German mein, third-person pronouns grammatical gender ke mutabiq rakhay jatay hain. Ye English se mukhtalif hai, jahan third-person pronouns biologiocal gender par based hote hain: ‘he’/‘she’ for logon k liye, or ‘it’ for cheezon ya concepts k liye.
Masculine nouns:Yahan note karain ke masculine nouns are replaced by er, insaano, janwaro or cheezon par farq nahi parta..
Feminine nouns:Feminine amooman sie se replace kiye jatay hain.

unit_name: Neuter nouns aur Pronouns ka Introduction

learning_content.title: Neuter Nouns
learning_content.content: Neuter nouns ko German language mein 'es' ky zariye replace kiya jata hai. Maslan. 'The kid is beautiful.' ko hum 'Es ist schön.' mein tabdeel kar saktay hain.

learning_content.title: Pronouns Variation
learning_content.content: German language zara complex hai English ky comparison mein jab hum baat kar rahe hotay hain pronouns ki. Mehnat lazmi hai jab hum personal pronouns objects ki tarah use kar rahe hotay hain. Lekin English mein sirf kuch pronouns hi change hotay hain, baaki sab wese ky wese rehtay hain chahe aap unhen subject ky tor par use karain ya object ky:

learning_content.title: Pronouns in accusative and dative cases
learning_content.content: German mein takreeban tamam pronouns apni shakal badal letay hain. Aur yeh bhi depend kartay hain ky aap unhen accusative case mein istmal kar rahe hain ya dative. Maslan, agar pronoun kisi noun ky jaga ky kaam kar raha hota hai jo kay jumlay ki object ki haisiyat ikhtiyar karti hai, to phir pronoun ko mozu case mein hona parta hai, accusative ya dative

learning_content.title: Accusative pronouns for the direct object
learning_content.content:
Agar pronoun ek sentence main direct object hota hai, toh ye accusative form main hota hai:

'I see the man' translate hota hai 'Main usay dekhta hun'

'He buys the car' translate hota hai 'Wo car khareedta hai'

Aur yahan aur examples hain jin main pronoun direct object hai:

'Do you see me?' translate hota hai 'Kya tum mujhe dekhte ho?'

'I love you' translate hota hai 'Main tumse mohabbat karta hoon'

'Do you like her?' translate hota hai 'Kya tum usay pasand karte ho?'

'The laptop? I bought it.' translate hota hai 'Laptop? Main ne khareeda hai.'

'He is going to visit us.' translate hota hai 'Wo humain milne aane wala hai.'

'The CDs. Have you seen them?' translate hota hai 'CDs. Kya tumne unhe dekha hai?'

learning_content.title: Accusative pronouns after prepositions
learning_content.content:
Note karein ke accusative case main similar condition 'through', 'for', 'against', 'without' aur 'around' jaisay prepositions k baad bhi hoti hai:

'The flowers are for you.' translate hota hai 'Phool tumhare liye hain.'

'I wouldn’t like to go without you.' translate hota hai 'Main tumhare bagair nahi jana chahta.'

learning_content.title: Pronouns in the dative case
learning_content.content:
Agar pronoun ek sentence main indirect object hai, toh aapko dative pronoun ki zaroorat hoti hai:

'She shows the man the book.' translate hota hai 'Woh admi ko kitab dikhata hai.'

unit_name: Dative pronouns ba'ad prepositions aur verbs

learning_content.title: Dative pronouns ka istemaal ba'ad kuch prepositions aur verbs
learning_content.content:
Kuch khas prepositions aur verbs ke ba'ad dative pronoun ka istemaal bhi zaroori hota hai. Kuch aham verbs jo dative case ka istemaal karte hain we hain: tankhwa 'shukriya', madad 'madad', peecha 'peecha'
. Prepositions jo dative case mein liye jaate hain we hain: alawa 'alawa', se 'se, bahar', kareeb 'paas, kareeb', samne 'baraks', saath 'saath', ke ba'ad 'ke ba'ad, ki taraf', se 'se, liye', se 'se', ki taraf 'ki taraf'.

learning_content.title: Tamam form
learning_content.content:
Ye ek list hai zamairein dative case mein:
me 'mai', tum 'tum (informal)', tum 'tum', aap 'aap (formal)', aap 'aap', wo 'wo (male)', us 'us, wo', wo 'wo (female)', us 'us, wo', ye 'ye', us 'us', hum 'hum', hum 'hum, us', tum 'tum (informal)', tum 'tum', aap 'aap (formal)', aap 'aap', wo 'wo (they)', in 'in'.
Dhyan de us aur tum accusative case mein bhi wahi hain.

learning_content.title: Misaal
learning_content.content:
Mujhe botal-e-sharab do, barae karam.
Kya ye mobile tumhara hai?
Mai uske saath kaam nahi kar sakta.
Mujhe aapka shukriya ada karna chahiye.
Zyada tafseel ke liye prepositions dekhein Unit 24.

learning_content.title: Aam Istemaal walay Jumlay jo Dative case ya Dative pronoun mangtay hain
learning_content.content:
Mazameen men kuch aise tadaad walay jumlay bhi hain jo dative case aur aam taur par aik dative pronoun ki zaroorat hoti hai:


Wie geht es dir/Ihnen/euch? How are you? (Aap ka kaisa hai?)
_ Es geht mir gut. I am well. (Mujhe acha hai.)
_ Es tut mir Leid. I am sorry. (Mujhe ma'azrat chahye.)
_ Meine Nase/Mein Kopf tut mir weh. My nose/My head hurts. (Mera naak/Sir dard kar rha hai.)
_ Mir ist kalt/warm. I am cold/warm. (Mujhe thand/garmai lag rahi hai.)

learning_content.title: Sikhane ka Tip
learning_content.content:
Lastly– don’t feel overwhelmed by the sheer number of different pronouns in German. As a beginner you will mostly use the nominative form (ich, du, er, sie, es etc.) and some common phrases (Wie geht es dir? etc.). The more exposure you have to the language, the more you will get used to the diﬀerent forms and the more conﬁdent you will feel about dealing with them.

Antim– German zuban men diﬀerent pronouns ki tadaad se na ghabrain. As a beginner aap aam taur par nominative form istemaal karain ge (jaisa ke ich, du, er, sie, es etc.) aur kuch aam phrases (jaisa ke Wie geht es dir? etc.). Zaban se aap jitna mukammil honge, aap in diﬀerent forms ki aadat karain ge aur inhen deal karne ke liye aap more conﬁdent mehsoos karain ge.

learning_content.content: Yeh checklist aapko accusative case mai saare personal pronouns yaad karne mai madad karega.

learning_content.title: Kya aap dative case mai saare personal pronouns jante hai?
learning_content.content: Yeh checklist aapko dative case mai saare personal pronouns memorize karne mai madad karega.

learning_content.title: Grammatical gender ka kya matlab hota hai? Yeh personal pronouns ke liye kyun zaruri hai?
learning_content.content: Grammatical gender personal pronouns ki understanding ke liye bohat zaruri hai. Yeh aapko pronouns ko behtar samajhne mai madad karta hai.

learning_content.title: Kaise faisle kare ki zaban ki kis surat mai personal pronoun ka istemal karain dative ya accusative case?
learning_content.content: Yeh hawale se yeh checklist aapko sahi faisle lene mai madad dega ke aapko personal pronoun ka istemal kab aur kaise karna chahiye accusative ya dative case mai.

unit_name: UNIT SIXTEEN: Malikana sifat ke adjectives

learning_content.title: Malikana sifat ke adjectives kya hain?
learning_content.content: Malikana sifat woh lafz hain jaise ke 'mera', 'tumhara', 'uska', 'uski' jo iss baat ki nishaandahi karte hain ke kuch kisi ki milkiyat hai.

learning_content.title: Estemaal Angrezi aur German zabano mai
learning_content.content: Malikana sifat Angrezi aur German zuban mai kuch isi terhan estemaal hoti hain. Agar koi cheez mardane shakhs ki milkiyat mai hai, to mardana zamir 'uska' istemal hota hai keh yeh uski hai. Agar koi cheez kisi khawateen ki ya zyada se zyada logon ki milkiyat mai ho, to aap khawateen ka zamir 'uski' ya jamid zamir jaise 'humara' ya 'un ka' chunte hain.

learning_content.title: Malikana sifat ke adjectives German zabano mai
learning_content.content:
Yeh ek jaiza hai malikana sifat ke adjectives ka:

ich -> I -> mein (my)

du -> you (informal) -> tumhara (your)

Sie -> you (formal) -> Aapka (your)

er -> he -> uska (his)

sie -> she -> uski (her)

es -> it -> uska (his)

wir -> we -> humara (our)

ihr -> you (informal) -> tumhara (your)

learning_content.title: Possessive adjectives in the nominative case
learning_content.content:
Azad case mein, muarraf kazaya ki termination masculine ya na-mutanasib naam se pehle nahin milti. Agar naam zaanana ya jama hota hai, to -e zaat ke maalik se joda jata hai:


Das ist mein Bruder. (Yeh mera bhai hai.)


Das ist meine Mutter. (Yeh meri maa hai.)


Das ist mein Auto. (Yeh meri car hai.)


Meine Geschwister wohnen in Berlin. (Mere bhaion aur behnon ki rehaish Berlin mai hai.)

learning_content.title: Possessive adjectives in the accusative case
learning_content.content:
Aap yaad hoga mukhtasar case mein, jahan masculine nouns ke liye azad article ein se einen mein tabdeel hojata hai. Maalik ki zaat waisa hi patter follow karta hai aur jab masculine noun ke samne aata hai to -en shamil karta hai. Feminine aur jama forms extra -e shamil karte hain:


Sie triﬀt ihren Bruder. (Woh apne bhai se milti hai.)


Sie triﬀt ihre Schwester. (Woh apni behen se milti hai.)


Sie sieht ihr Kind. (Woh apne bachay ko dekhti hai.)


Sie triﬀt ihre Freunde. (Woh apne dosto se milti hai.)

learning_content.title: Possessive adjectives in the dative case
learning_content.content:
Dative case mein, maalik ka zaat termination -em le leta hai jab masculine ya na-mutanasib naam ki taraf hawala karta hai aur agar naam zaanana hai to -er. Jama mein -en shamil karen:


Er spricht mit seinem Bruder. (Woh apne bhai se baat karta hai.)


Er spricht mit seiner Schwester. (Woh apni behen se baat karta hai.)

learning_content.title: He talks to his child.
learning_content.content: Wooh apnay bachay say baat kar raha hai.

learning_content.title: He talks to his parents.
learning_content.content: Wooh apnay maa baap say baat kar raha hai.

learning_content.title: Possessive adjective endings in the genitive case
learning_content.content: Shuru ki satah par, aap galiban genitive case mein malikana sifatoon ka istemal nahi karain ge, lekin aap unhein likhay huay matn ya recording mein dekhain ge. Muzakar aur monas sifat k liye -es khitamatein hain, aur mo'anis aur mukhtalif aqsaam k liye -er.

learning_content.title: This is the friend of our son.
learning_content.content: Yeh hamaray baitay ka dost hai.

learning_content.title: This is the friend of our daughter.
learning_content.content: Yeh hamari beti ka dost hai.

learning_content.title: The friends of our children are very nice.
learning_content.content: Hamare bachon ke dost bohot achay hain.

learning_content.title: Spelling variation for euer
learning_content.content: Note that euer (‘your’, informal plural) is slightly differently spelled when connected with a female noun or plural: Ist das eure Mutter? Sind das eure Eltern?

learning_content.title: Is it your mother?
learning_content.content: Kia yeh aap ki maa hai?

learning_content.title: Are these your parents?
learning_content.content: Kia yeh aap k maa baap hain?

learning_content.title: Summary of possessive endings
learning_content.content: Yahaan malikana khitmat k liye ikhtisar hai:

learning_content.title: Possessive Pronouns
learning_content.content: Aapko possessive pronouns samajhne honge. Ye hain: 'my', 'our', 'your' (singular, informal), 'your' (plural, informal), 'your' (singular, formal), 'your' (plural, formal), 'his', 'her', 'their', 'its'.

learning_content.title: Exercise 16.2
learning_content.content:
Aapko nominative case main missing endings fill karni hogi. Kuch cases main koi endings ki zaroorat nahi hogi. Maslan:

'Wie ist Ihr _____ Adresse? – Mein _____ Adresse ist Falkenweg 12.' iska sahih jawab hoga, 'Wie ist Ihre Adresse? – Meine Adresse ist Falkenweg 12.'.

learning_content.title: Exercise 16.3
learning_content.content: Aapko in logon ke baare main yeh likhna hoga ke wo kya dhoondh rahe hain, examples ko follow karte hue. Yeh accusative case ka istemaal karen. Maslan: 'Claudia → Tasche (f) → Claudia sucht ihre Tasche.', 'Matthias → Führerschein (m) → Matthias sucht seinen Führerschein.'

learning_content.title: <h1>Exercise 16.4<h1>
learning_content.content:
Aap ne mukhtalif jumlayin translate karne hain. Yeh jumlay hain:

1.
Yeh mera walid hai.
2.
Yeh meri walida hai
3.
Jörg apna credit card dhoond raha hai.
4.
Susanne apni driving licence dhoond rahi hai.
5
Hum apne doston se milte hain.
6.
Sebastian apni walida se baat kar raha hai.
7.
Arianne apne bhai se baat kar rahi hai.
8.
Bachay apne dada dadi se baat kar rahe hain.

learning_content.title: <h1>Checklist<h1>
learning_content.content:
1
Kya aap german me tamam possessive pronouns jante hain?

2
Possessive pronouns ke endings ka kis se ittefaq hona chahiye?

3
Kaun sa possessive pronoun apni spelling ko tabdeel karta hai jab uska istemal feminine nouns ya plural me hota hai?

learning_content.title: Reﬂexive verbs kyaa hain?
learning_content.content: Reﬂexive verbs woh actions/verbs hotay hain jin ma aik shakhs khud par koi amal kar raha ho. English ma iska examples hain: ‘Maine apna aap ko dho lia.’ ‘Usne apne liye aik naya computer khared lia.’

learning_content.title: Reﬂexive verbs ki istemal ki frequency
learning_content.content: Reﬂexive verbs German zuban ma English se zyada istemal hoti hain. Aksar ye roz marra ki activities ki taraf ishara karti hain, isliye jab aap apni daily routine ke bare ma batana chahte hain, to ye bohat mufeed hoti hain.

learning_content.title: Ahem Reﬂexive verbs
learning_content.content:
Ye kuch aam tor par istemal hone wale reﬂexive verbs hain jo German zuban ma hain:
sich amüsieren: Apne aap ko enjoy karna
sich anziehen: Kapray pehenna
sich ausziehen: Kapray utarna
sich beeilen: Jaldi karna
sich duschen: Khud ko naha leyna/ Naha lena
sich entscheiden: Faisla karna
sich entschuldigen: Maafi mangna
sich kämmen: Apne Baal saaf karna
sich rasieren: Daarhi/Bal saaf karna
sich schminken: Makeup lagana
sich treﬀen: Milna
sich umziehen: Kapray badalna
sich waschen: Khud ko dho leyna/ Dho lena

learning_content.title: Reﬂexive Pronouns Introduction
learning_content.content: Aik reflexive verb hamesha aik reflexive pronoun kay sath hoti hai, aik aisa lafz jesa ke 'myself', 'yourself', 'himself' aadi. Ziyadatar reflexive verbs accusative pronouns laytay hain: mich, dich, sich, uns, euch aur sich. Yahan hum bataye gay hain ke 'sich waschen' (jis ka matlab hota hai 'to have a wash') ke sath yeh kese kaam kertay hain:

learning_content.title: Usage of Reﬂexive Verbs
learning_content.content:
Yahan or bhi misalain hain ke reﬂexive verbs kese kaam karti hain:

  • 'Ich beeile mich.' matlab 'I hurry (up).'
  • 'Du duschst dich jeden Tag.' matlab 'You have a shower every day.'
  • 'Er rasiert sich.' matlab 'He shaves (himself).'
  • 'Wir treﬀen uns mit Steﬃ und Boris.' matlab 'We meet Steﬃ and Boris.'
  • 'Amüsieren Sie sich?' matlab 'Are you enjoying yourself?'

learning_content.title: When to use a dative pronoun
learning_content.content:
Reﬂexive verbs normally take the accusative pronoun. Tabdeeli sirf tab hoti hai jab aap kuch specific karna chahtay hain, maslan, kaunsi clothes aap pehan rahe hain ya aap apne jism ke kis hisay ko saf kar rahay hain. Phir naya item direct object ban jata hai sentence ka, aur reflexive pronoun - as the indirect object - takes the dative form:

  • 'Ich ziehe mich an.' => 'Ich ziehe mir eine Jacke an.' matlab 'I put on a jacket.'
  • 'Ich wasche mich.' => 'Ich wasche mir die Haare.' matlab 'I wash my hair.'
  • 'Kämmst du dich?' => 'Kämmst du dir die Haare?' matlab 'Are you combing your hair?'

learning_content.title: Overview of all dative pronouns
learning_content.content: Yeh hai tamaam dative pronouns ki overview.

learning_content.title: Separable verbs
learning_content.content: jab koi reﬂexive verb separable hota hai, tu pronoun ﬁnite verb ke bad ati hai or preﬁx jumle ke aakhir mein jata hai:   anziehen → Wo kapre pehnte hain (Wo apne aap ko tayar karti hai). umziehen → Wo dressing room mein kapre change karte hain. (wo dressing room mein apne aap ko change karte hain).

learning_content.title: More useful expressions
learning_content.content: Ye zara observe karien ke in mein commonly used expressions mein reﬂexive verbs ka involvement kesa hai:  sich das Gesicht waschen  to wash one’s face sich die Hände waschen  to wash one’s hands sich die Zähne putzen  to brush one’s teeth sich die Nase putzen  to blow one’s nose   Apne hathon ko dhoen!  Main apne daant saaf karta hon.  Wo apna naak saaf karta hai.
Mai ne shower liya.
Mai ne apne daant saaf kiye.
Mai ne apne kapde pehn liye.
Mai ne apne baal kangi ki.
Mai ne jacket pehni.
Mai jaldi kar raha tha.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
• Reﬂexive verbs hamesha kis ke saath aate hain?
  • Commonly used reﬂexive verbs ka reference kya hai?
  • Most reflexive pronouns usually kis case ko lete hain?
  • What happens to the reﬂexive pronoun when you add information on what it is that you are washing or putting on?

learning_content.title: Manfiyat
learning_content.content: Manfi bayanon ko banana k liye mukhtalif tariqe hote hain, yeh depend krta hai aap adjective, verb ya phir noun se deal kr rahe hain.

learning_content.title: English mai Manfiyat
learning_content.content:
English mai, aap aam tor pe ‘not’ ka istemal adjectives aur verbs k sath krte hain, aur verbs ko bhi zyadatar 'to do' ki zaroorat hoti hai:


‘The house is not very nice.’ Yani ghar acha nahi boaht.


‘They don’t (do not) drink coffee.’ Yani vo log coffee nahi peete.


Nouns thore se straightforward nahi hoty; inka mana (negation) mukhtalif shapes mai ataa hai jaise ke ’no’, ‘do + not’, ‘not’ ya ‘not any’:


‘There are no sausages left.’ Yani koi sausage bachi nahi hai.


‘He doesn’t have children.’ Yani, uske paas bachey nahi hain.


‘I haven’t got have any money.’ Yani paas koi paise nahi hain.

learning_content.title: Kein ka istemaal
learning_content.content:
'Kein' ka istemaal aam taur par nouns ke saath hota hai:

Mai paas ek gari hai.

Mai paas koi gari nahi hai.

learning_content.title: Nicht ka istemaal Adjectives aur Verbs ke saath
learning_content.content:
'Nicht' ka istemaal English ke 'not' ke barabar hota hai. Iska use adjectives ya verbs ke connection mein hota hai:

Nicht + adjective

Ye CD mehngi nahi hai.

Ye ghar zyada khubsurat nahi hai.

Nicht + verb

Wo nahi aa rahi.

Mai ab cigaratte nahi peeta.

learning_content.title: Nicht ka position
learning_content.content:
Shuruaati darje par nicht ka position samjhna thoda confusing ho sakta hai. Neeche diye gaye directions aapki madad kar sakte hain isko samajhne me:

- Present tense me nicht usually ﬁnite verb ke baad aata hai:
Wah nahi aa rahi hai.
Wo cinema ko dekhne nahi jata.

- Iske pehle time ka expression ho sakta hai:
Wah aaj nahi aa rahi hai.

- Present perfect tense me jo haben ke saath banta hai, nicht uske saamne aata hai:
Mai ne ye book nahi khareedi hai.

learning_content.title: Kein ka istemal
learning_content.content:
German mein sentence ko negative bananay k liye ek important word hai kein, jo normally aik noun k sath link hota hai:

  • Kein Problem. - Koi Issue nhi.
  • Das ist keine Antwort - Yeh kisi bhi jawab ka muqabla nahi kar sakta.
  • Ich habe keine Zeit. - Mujhe waqt nahi hai.

German mein aik noun ko negate karne k liye apko sirf kein ka istemal karna paray ga, jo english mein ‘no’, ‘not a(n)’, ‘not any’ ya phir ‘do not have’/‘haven’t got’ k barabar hai.

learning_content.title: Kein ke endings
learning_content.content:
Kein behaves exactly like the indeﬁnite article (ein, eine, ein). It must agree in gender (masculine, feminine, neuter), number (singular, plural) and case (nominative, accusative, dative, genitive) with the noun:

  • Er hat keinen Bruder. (accusative, masculine)
  • Sie hat keine Schwester. (accusative, feminine)
  • Er hat kein Kind. (accusative, neuter)
  • Sie hat keine Geschwister. (accusative plural)

Yahan aik overview hai kein k tamam endings ka:

Jaisa k ap dekh sakte hain, wo ein k endings k sath identical hain – siwaye plural k, jahan wo possessive k endings ko follow kar rahay hain, for instance mein.

learning_content.title: Phrases jahan nicht ya kein istemal ho sakta hai
learning_content.content:
Kuch phrases hote hain jahan ap ya to nicht ya phir kein ka istemal kar sakte hain. Un mein shamil hain:

  • Ich spreche nicht/kein Deutsch. - Mein german nahi bolta.
  • Er ist nicht/kein Ingenieur. - Wo engineer nahi hai.
  • Ich fahre nicht/kein Auto. - Mein car nahi chalata.

learning_content.title: Exercise 18.1
learning_content.content: Negative form mein sentences banayen nicht ka use kar ke. Yeh yaqeeni banayen ke aap nicht ko sahi jagah pe lagaye.

learning_content.title: Example
learning_content.content: Peter arbeitet gern. → Peter arbeitet nicht gern.

learning_content.title: Exercise 18.2
learning_content.content: Tamam sawalon ka negative response dein kein ka sahi roop istimal kar ke.

learning_content.title: Example
learning_content.content: Ist das ein Porsche? → Nein, das ist kein Porsche.

learning_content.title: Exercise 18.3
learning_content.content:
Mutarajjim karein aglay jumlay.
1 Luke nahi peeta.
2 Sheher khubsurat nahi hai.
3 Computer sasta nahi hai.
4 Ye door nahi hai.
5 Paul ke paas cycle nahi hai.
6 Unke paas car nahi hai.
7 Uske paas koi waqt nahi hai.
8 Arnd ke paas koi paisa nahi hai.
9 Ye acha khayal nahi hai.
10 Main French nahi bolta.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
t1 Nicht kab istemal karte hain?
t2 Kein kab istemal karte hain?
t3 Kein kis tarah noun ke sath mutafiq hona chahiye?
t4 Kya aap kuch jumlay yaad hain jahan aap ya to nicht ya kein istemal kar sakte hain?

learning_content.title: Comparative and superlative
learning_content.content: Jab aap cheezon ka muqabla karte hain, aap keh sakte hain keh kuch chote, bade, saste, ya zyada mahenge hain (muqabla) ya phir woh sab se chota, sab se bara wagaira hain (behtareen).

learning_content.title: Usage in English
learning_content.content:
Angrezi mein, muqabla '–er' jod kar chote sifat ko ya 'more' lafz ka istemal karke banaya jata hai:
Ye laptop sasta hain.
London Paris se bohat ziyada dilchaspi hai.
Behtareen banane ke liye aap ya to ‘-est’ jodte hain ya phir 'most' lafz istemal karte hain:
Ye laptop sab se sasta hain.
London sab se ziyada dilchaspi shehar hai.

learning_content.title: Mutabadil ingizaish
learning_content.content: Ziyada tar sifatien sirf -er ko imtiaz men shamil karti hain. Jaisa ke, chhota (klein) ban jata hai chhoter (kleiner), tez (schnell) ban jata hai tezer (schneller), badsoorat (hässlich) ban jata hai badsoorater (hässlicher), aur boring (langweilig) ban jata hai boringer (langweiliger).

learning_content.title: Anomalous Shapes
learning_content.content: Aksar sifatien aik bayanati pattern ko follow kartien hain. Sirf chand istisnaon ka hona zaroori hai. For example, acha (gut) behter (besser) ban jata hai, aur bohat (viel) zyada (mehr) ban jata hai.

learning_content.title: Adding -er and adding umlaut + -er
learning_content.content: Aksar aik he awaaz wali sifatien jo ke a, o, ya u ke sath hoti hain, woh bhi aik umlaut ko shamil karti hain. Mutabadilat ki misal ke taur par, uncha (hoch) uncha tar (höher) ban jata hai, lamba (lang) lamba tar (länger) ban jata hai, mazboot (stark) mazboot tar (stärker) ban jata hai, garam (warm) garam tar (wärmer) ban jata hai.

learning_content.title: Comparative and Superlative Adjectives
learning_content.content:
Berlin München se barha hai. Berlin Munich se bara hai. Rhein Themse se lamba hai. Rhein Thames se lambi hai.

Bayaanbardaari lafz am ke saath aur -sten wali sifat ke saath mukammal hoti hai.

t

Aik he sillabe wale ashkal k saath -sten ke sath sath amlyat daraj za'il namonon mei mojood hai:

jung → am jüngsten (sab se kam)

t

groß → am größten (sab se ziada, sab se lamba)

t

lang → am längsten (sab se lamba)

t

warm → am wärmsten (sab se garam)

learning_content.title: Irregular forms of Adjectives
learning_content.content:
Wo sifaat jo aam pattern pe amal nahi karti, un mei daraj zail shamil hain:

t

hoch 'high' ke liye superlative am höchsten 'highest' hai

t

teuer → teurer (ziada expensive)

t

dunkel → dunkler (darker)

t

klein → am kleinsten (smallest)

t

schnell → am schnellsten (fastest)

t

hässlich → am hässlichsten (ugliest)

t

langweilig → am langweiligsten (most boring)

t

gut → am besten (best)

t

viel → am meisten (most)

learning_content.title: Gern ka Istemal
learning_content.content: Jo kaam aapko pasand ho ya jo cheez aapko sab se zyada pasand ho, usay bayan karne ke liye gern adverb ka tashbeehi aur afzal shakl ka ilm hona zaroori hai, jo ke bohat ghair mutadil hai.

learning_content.title: Comparatives aur Superlatives ka Istemal Pehlay Naam ke Samne
learning_content.content: Is Unit ke misaal mein, hum tashbeehi aur afzal shakl ke istemaal par guftagu karte hain jo naam ke baad aatay hain. In shaklon ke endings tabdeel ho sakhti hain jab woh kisi naam se pehlay aate hain. Unit 25 dekhen.

learning_content.title: Comparatives aur Superlatives Ka Practice
learning_content.content:
Bernd bohat parhta hai.

Frauke ziada parhti hai.

Jörg sab se zyada parhta hai.

Main pani peene ka shokeen hun. Main coffee peene ko tarjih deta hun. Main sab se zyada pasand karta hun beer peena.

learning_content.title: Exercise 19.4
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences:


1. London ki size Paris se barri hai.
2. Rhine ki length Danube se ziyada lambi hai.
3. Jens ki age Susan se ziyada hai.
4. Boris ki samajh Claus se ziyada achi hai.
5. Gabriella sabse samajhdar hai.
6.Hawai jahaz ki keemat train se ziyada hai.

learning_content.title: Content 7
learning_content.content: Ralf Michael se zyada aahista drive karta hai.

learning_content.title: Content 8
learning_content.content: Kitab Film se behtar hai.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. Comparative kis tarah banaya jata hai?
2. Superlative kis tarah form kiya jata hai?
3. Long adjectives ya adverbs k liye comparative ya superlative ka koi khas form hai ?
4. Adjective ya adverb k stem mai tabdeeli kab hoti hai ?
5. Pronunciation asaan bananay k liye kya tabdeeliyan ki jati hain?

learning_content.title: Modal Verbs Kiya Hain?
learning_content.content: Modals wo verbs hain jo ek sentence main kisi khaas 'mood' ko express karti hain; jaisa ki aap kuch kar sakte hain, chahiye kuch karne ko ya kuch karna hi chahiye.

learning_content.title: Modal Verbs In English
learning_content.content: English main, modal verbs aam taur pe ek sath use hoti hain ek main verb ke sath infinitive main: 'Agar aap free hain, to aap hamare sath aa sakte hain.'

learning_content.title: Modal Verbs In Detail
learning_content.content:
Dürfen – may/to be allowed to
Modal dürfen use hota hain izazat express karne ke liye.

learning_content.title: Dürfen - May/Permitted
learning_content.content:
You are allowed to smoke here yani aap yahan dhoom-sakerne Shree ki ejazat hai.

Darf ich Ihnen helfen? matlab kia main app ki mudad kar sakta hoon.

Jab 'nicht' kay sath istemal hota hai, toi dürfen ka matlab hota hai kuch jo aap karny kay liyay majboor nahi hain:
Sie dürfen hier nicht rauchen yani aapko yahan dhoom-sakerne ki ejazat nahi hai.
Man darf hier nicht fotograﬁieren yani aapko yahan photo lene ki ejazat nahi hai.

learning_content.title: Können – Can/To be able to
learning_content.content:
Kannst du mir helfen? yani kya tum meri madad kar sakte ho?
Er kann sehr gut Salsa tanzen yani woh bohat acha Salsa dance kar sakta hai.

learning_content.title: Müssen – Must/To have to
learning_content.content:
Ich muss jetzt gehen yani mjhe ab jana hai.
Er muss am Wochenende arbeiten yani usy haftey ke akhir mein kam karna parega.

learning_content.title: Müssen - Don’t have to
learning_content.content:
When used with the negative nicht, müssen does not convey the meaning of
prohibition as in English, but means ‘don’t have to’.

learning_content.title: Dürfen + nicht - Must not
learning_content.content:
To say ‘you must not’, use dürfen + nicht:
Du darfst nicht rauchen.
You must not smoke.

learning_content.title: Sollen – To be supposed to, should, ought to
learning_content.content:
The modal sollen means ‘to be supposed to’ or ‘should’:
Sie sollen mehr Sport treiben.
You should do more sport.

learning_content.title: Wollen – Want
learning_content.content:
The modal wollen usually expresses an intention or desire and corresponds to
the English ‘to want to’:
Ich will nach New York ﬂiegen.
I want to ﬂy to New York.

learning_content.title: Modal Verbs Explanation
learning_content.content:
Dehaan 'will' aur 'would' Urdu may be 'chahna' aur 'chahye ga' hota hai. Lekin German zubaan mein in ka istemaal mukhtalif tareeqay se hota hai jo ap ko samjhaaiye gaye hain.

Important Note: 'will' ka matlab 'wollen' hota hai magar is ka istemal future tense banaane k liye nhi hota. Ye German mein 'werden' istemal hota hai. Misal k tor par 'woh germany jaaye gi' ko german mein 'Sie wird nach Deutschland fahren' kaha jata hai.

learning_content.title: Examples on Mögen/Möchten
learning_content.content:
mögen/möchten yani like/would like ka istemal logon, khanae, jagahon aur activities k hawaly se hota hai:

Example: 'Mujhe Barbra Streisand pasand hai', 'Unhe Paris pasand hai', 'Usay Tennis pasand hai'

learning_content.title: Use of Mögen/Möchten without a second verb
learning_content.content:
Ye aksar apne subjective form, möchten, mein istemal hota hai jiska matlab would like to hota hai. Misal k tor par: 'woh kaam karna chahta hai', 'woh nayi gaari khareedna chahta hai'

Ye zamir mögen aksar dosray verb k bagher istemal hota hai. Misal k tor par: 'mujhe aik glass beer chahiye, please.'

unit_name: Unit 20: Modal verbs used with another verb

learning_content.title: Jaisa ke English mai, modals kaam aam tor par dosray verb ke sath istemal hote hain
learning_content.content: Woh bahut achhi tango nach sakte hain. Tumhein zyada khelna chahiye. Jab ham English aur German ke modals par nazar dalte hain to ek bari farq samne aata hai. English mai, modal verb aur mukhya verb ek sath rehte hain; jab ke German mai, modal verb aur mukhya verb alag ho jate hain.

learning_content.title: Modal aur separable verbs
learning_content.content: Jab aap modal verb ka istemal separable verb ke sath kartay ho to separable verb ek sath rehta hai aur vo sentence ke akhir mai jata hai.

learning_content.title: Overview of all modal verbs and their endings
learning_content.content: Yahaan sabhi modal verbs aur unke endings ka ek overview hai. Yaad rahe, jab aap unhein seekhne ki koshish karte hain to kuch patterns samne aate hain.

learning_content.title: Irregular Patterns for Modal Verb Endings
learning_content.content: Kya modal verb endings ke liye irregular patterns hai?

learning_content.title: Main Verb in a Sentence with a Modal Verb
learning_content.content: Modal verb wale sentence mein main verb kahan hoti hai?

learning_content.title: How to Use Mögen?
learning_content.content: Mögen ka istemaal kaise karte hain?

learning_content.title: Translation of Sollen
learning_content.content: Sollen ka tarjuma kaise karenge?

learning_content.title: Translation of ‘must not’
learning_content.content: ‘Must not’ ka tarjuma kaise karenge?

learning_content.title: Moajooda Mukammal Waqt (The present perfect tense)
learning_content.content: Mazi ke waqt ki English aur German main do mukammal tenses hoti hein, jo ke moajooda mukammal waqt (The present perfect tense) aur asaan mazi (simple past tense) kehtay hein.

learning_content.title: Mukhtalif Istemaal (Different usages)
learning_content.content: English main aap moajooda mukammal waqt ka istemaal karte hein agar koi mazi ka waqia abhi tak mojooda se kafi qareeb hai aur 'just' jaise kuch khaas alfaz ke saath: 'Main ne abhi us se baat ki hai'. Aur zyada tar situations ke liye aap asaan mazi ka istemaal karte hein: 'Mene aakhri dafa us se do saal pehle baat ki thi'.

learning_content.title: Bazat aur Ghair Bazat Feal – Aik Jaiza (Regular and irregular verbs – an overview)
learning_content.content:
German ki zyadatar fealon ke liye aap moajooda mukammal waqt bana sakte hain 'ke paas hona' ya 'haben' + mukammal mazi ka feal: 'gehört' + 'haben' = 'suni hui hai'; 'getrunken' + 'haben' = 'pee hui hai'.

Moajooda Mukammal Waqt:
Main ne us se baat ki hai.
Asaan Mazi Waqt:
Main ne us se baat ki.

learning_content.title: Regular, Irregular Verbs and Their Usage
learning_content.content:
Jaisa ke English mein, kuch verbs regular (jaise 'have listened'/sunna) hote hain aur kuch irregular (jaise 'have drunk'/peena) hote hain German mein. Kuch verbs mein 'sein' ka finite form use hota hai 'haben' ke bajaye, plus past participle:

Ich bin nach Paris gefahren. (Main Paris chala gaya hoon).

learning_content.title: Formation and Details of Regular Verbs
learning_content.content: Regular verbs (yaani weak verbs) ka present perfect tense banane ke liye, 'haben' ka present tense use hota hai + past participle. Participle banane ke liye, verb ke stem ka use hota hai (infinitive minus -en) aur 'ge-' shuru mein aur '-t' end mein add hota hai.

learning_content.title: Finite Verb 'Haben' and Its Usage
learning_content.content:
Jab aap is structure ko sentence mein use karte hain, 'haben' ke endings personal pronoun ke saath match karni chahiye – yeh sentence mein finite verb hoti hai. Past participle change nahi hota. Dekhiye 'spielen' (to play) ka complete present perfect tense:

ich habe gespielt (main ne khela hai)

wir haben gespielt (hum ne khela hai)

du hast gespielt (tum ne khela hai)

ihr habt gespielt (aap ne khela hai)

Sie haben gespielt (woh khela hai)

Sie haben gespielt (Unho ne khela hai)

er/sie/es hat gespielt (woh khela hai)

sie haben gespielt (woh khela hai)

learning_content.title: Word Order in Sentences
learning_content.content:
Aap examples se dekh rahe honge ki 'haben' sentence mein dusre position par hota hai, jab ke past participle sentence ya clause ke end mein jata hai:

Sie hat ein neues Kleid gekauft. (Usne nayi dress khareed li).

Gestern habe ich Tennis gespielt. (Kal main ne tennis khela).

learning_content.title: Infinitive Past Participle Formation
learning_content.content:
kauf-en → ge-kauf-t (khareedna → khareed liya)

spiel-en → ge-spiel-t (khelna → khela)

sag-en → ge-sag-t (kehna → kaha)

unit_name: Unit 21 - Irregular verbs in more detail

learning_content.title: Formation
learning_content.content: Irregular verbs (jise hum mazboot verbs bhi kehte hain) zyadatar cases mein stem ke aaghaz mein ge- ka istemal aur akhir mein -en laga kar apna past participle banate hain: Irregular verbs ka aksar tar stem vowel change hota hai.

learning_content.title: Word order
learning_content.content:
Jaisa ke regular verbs ke saath hota hai, past participle sentence ya clause ke akhir mein hota hai:
Hast du den neuen Bond-Film gesehen? Kya aapne nayi Bond film dekhi?
Wir haben eine neue Wohnung gefunden. Humne eik naya flat dhoond liya.
Maike hat mir sehr geholfen. Maike ne mujhe bohat madad ki.
Sie haben zu viel Bier getrunken. Unhon ne bohat zyada beer peeli.

learning_content.title: Mixed verbs
learning_content.content:
Wahan ek verb group bhi hai (jo ke aksar mixed verbs ke naam se jaana jata hai) jis mein stem change hota hai lekin -t lagaate hain bajaye -en ke. Sabse ahem hain:
inﬁnitive ge + stem + t
bring-en → ge-brach-t
denk-en → ge-dach-t
wiss-en → ge-wuss-t

learning_content.title: Present Perfect Tense with Sein
learning_content.content:
The present perfect tense mai, motion verbs ne sein leti hai. Motion ya state change jesi verbs, present perfect ko sein ke finite form aur verb ke past participle ke sath form karti hain. Yahan kuch aisi misalein di gai hain:

  • Fahren (to go, to drive) → Ich bin nach Paris gefahren.
  • Fliegen (to fly)
  • Gehen (to go, to walk)
  • Kommen (to come)
  • Laufen (to run)
  • Schwimmen (to swim)

Zahir hai keh zyadatar participles -en mai khatam hote hain, lekin kuch exceptions bhi hote hain jaise ke - gereist.

learning_content.title: More Verbs with Sein
learning_content.content:
The following verbs also form the present perfect tense with sein and are irregular:

  • Wie lange seid ihr in den USA geblieben? (How long have you stayed in the States?)
  • Sie ist Lehrerin geworden. (She’s become a teacher.)
  • Bleiben → geblieben to stay
  • Sterben gestorban to die
  • Werden → geworden to become

unit_name: Moajuda Mukammal Zaman kay haben aur sein ka istemal

learning_content.title: Auxiliary Verbs Haben aur Sein ki Participle Forms
learning_content.content:
Haben aur sein ko auxiliary verbs ke tor par zyada ahmiyat di jati hai jab mojooda mukammal zaman ka dastoor banaya jata hai. Lekin inke participle forms janna bhi bohat zaruri hai.
Haben ki past participle form gehabt hai:
Er hat keine Zeit gehabt.
(Usne koi waqt nahi diya)
Sein ki past participle form irregular hoti hai – gewesen:
Wo bist du gewesen?
(Tum kahan the?)

learning_content.title: Verbs with stem endings in -d or -t
learning_content.content:
Un verbs ka khayal rakhna zaruri hai jin ke stem mein -d ya -t hota hai. In verbs ko participle banane ke liye extra -e ki zarurat hoti hai:
Hast du wieder so viel geredet?
(Kya tum phir se itna zyada baat karte the?)
Er hat viel gearbeitet.
(Usne bohat kaam kiya hai)

learning_content.title: Verbs with an inseparable prefix and Verbs ending in -ieren
learning_content.content:
Verbs ke inseparable prefix jaise ke be-, er-, -ver, -zer ke saath ge- nahi lagaya jata.
Er hat das Essen bezahlt.
(Usne khanay ka bill ada kar diya hai)
Wir haben das Auto verkauft.
(Humne car bech di hai.)
Ich habe meinen Terminkalender verloren.
(Maine apna diary kho diya hai)
Verbs ending in -ieren (for example studieren and passieren) also do not add ge- at the front:

learning_content.title: Separable verbs
learning_content.content:
Separable verbs form the past participle like other regular or irregular verbs,
but the preﬁx stays at the front:
Regular: preﬁx + ge + stem + t
Irregular: preﬁx + ge + stem + en
Here are some examples:
Hast du das Bier aufgemacht?
Have you opened the beer?
Die Eltern haben eingekauft.
The parents have done the shopping.
Bist du wieder früh aufgestanden?
Have you got up early again?
Wir haben drei Stunden ferngesehen.
We’ve watched television for three hours.

learning_content.title: Working with verb lists
learning_content.content: Most German coursebooks, grammars and dictionaries have a list of irregular verbs in which the past participles are given. Verbs which form the present perfect tense with sein are usually indicated with a ‘v.it’. We recommend that you use these lists regularly and learn the most important verbs by heart. As with most other grammar points – the more you practise, the more progress you will make with your language learning.

learning_content.title: Additional Information
learning_content.content: For more information on the simple past tense and when to use it in German see Unit 22.

learning_content.title: Herr Witte worked until nine o’clock.
learning_content.content: Herr Witte naukay tak kaam karte thay.

learning_content.title: She bought a new CD.
learning_content.content: Usne aik naya CD khareeda.

learning_content.title: Michael studied in Berlin.
learning_content.content: Michael ne Berlin mein parhaya.

learning_content.title: They paid by credit card.
learning_content.content: Unhone credit card se ada kiya.

learning_content.title: He went to the cinema.
learning_content.content: Wo cinema gaya.

learning_content.title: They watched television.
learning_content.content: Unhone television dekha.

learning_content.title: When did you get up?
learning_content.content: Tum kab uthay?

learning_content.title: What did you do yesterday?
learning_content.content: Tumne kal kya kiya?

learning_content.title: Sadah Maazi (The simple past tense)
learning_content.content: Sadah maazi tehzeeb yani German men ek main tense hai jo maazi ke waqiyat ki bayani k liye use hota hai. Jahan mojooda kaamil tense zyada tar bol-chal ki zaban men istemal hota hai, wahan sadah maazi zyada tar likhi german men istemal hota hai. Grammar ki kitabon men isy aksar preterite (Präteritum) ya imperfect (Imperfekt) kaha jata hai.

learning_content.title: Baa Qaida Aur Ghair Qaida Verbs (Regular and irregular verbs)
learning_content.content:
Angrezi men, sadah maazi men verbs ya to baa qaida hotay hen ya ghair qaida:
• Baa Qaida verbs sirf 'ed' jorein gay, infinitive men (‘play’ → ‘played’)
• Ghair Qaida verbs zyada tar aap k vowels badal jate hen (‘see’ → ‘saw’)... German men bhi ek aisi hi pattern hai:
• Ziyada tar baa Qaida verbs apnay stem men muqarara ikhatajaji shamil kar letay hen (spielen → ich spielte)
• Kafi saaray ghair qaida verbs apnay stem ko badal detay hen (sehen → ich sah)
Ghair qaida verbs ke sath sath thore se mukhtalif ikhatajaji bhi hen
Tamaam forms agay ki paragraphs men byan kiye gaye hen.

learning_content.title: Baa Qaida Verbs Detail (Regular verbs in detail)
learning_content.content: Baa Qaida verbs ki sadah maazi tashkeel k liye, stem len aur munasib ikhtataji shamil kerain.

learning_content.title: Examples
learning_content.content:
Jab woh bacha tha, usne Berlin mein reha.

Kal usne aik naya CD kharida.

learning_content.title: Variations
learning_content.content:
T, N, ya D ke sath jam'a huwai verbs ko asan tarikay se pronounce karne ke liye extra E ki zarurat hoti ha

[antworten → She didn’t answer]

[regnen → Yesterday it rained./Yesterday it was raining]

[reden → He talked for one hour.]

learning_content.title: Irregular verbs in detail
learning_content.content:
German, irregular verbs English ki tarah simple past ko form karti hain jis main aik stem vowel change hota ha jis ke mukablay main verb khatm hotay hain simple past tense main jo present tense main khatam hotay hain, alawa ich aur er/sie/es, jahan koi ending nahi hote hai

[Helvetica> sehen → she saw], [schreiben → she wrote], [gehen → I went].

learning_content.title: Examples
learning_content.content:
Kal mai ne aik film dekhi.
Usne aik khat likha.
Wo restaurant gae.

learning_content.title: Mixed Verbs
learning_content.content:
Kuch verbs hote hain jo apna stem vowel change kar dete hain, lekin unke pass -te endings hoti hain jaise regular verbs ki hoti hain. Inhe hum mixed verbs kehte hain. Sabse zaroori hain:
Sochna, Lana, Janna, Janna, Jalna

learning_content.title: Examples
learning_content.content:
Usne apne chhuttiyon ke bare mein socha.
Mujhe ye nahi pata tha.

learning_content.title: Haben, Sein and the Modal Verbs
learning_content.content:
Halenke simple past tense zyadatar written German mein use hota hai, lekin ye spoken language mein bhi hota hai. Khas taur par haben aur sein aur modal verbs ke liye. Yahan woh aik tafseel ke sath hain:
Haben aur Sein
Dono verbs quite irregular hote hain simple past tense mein. Yahan ek overview hai:

Ich
Tu
Sie
Er/Sie/Es
Wir
Ihr
Sie
Sie

learning_content.title: Jumlay Ki Misaalain
learning_content.content:
Ye kuch misaal hain:

‘I didn’t have any time.’ mein Urdu mein hoga ‘Mujhe waqt nahi tha’.

‘He was terribly hungry.’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Wo buhat bhooka tha’.

‘He was in London last year.’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Wo pechle saal London mein tha’.

‘Where were you?’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Tum kahan thay?’.

learning_content.title: Simple Past Tense mein Modal Verbs
learning_content.content:
Modal verbs bhi ‘mixed’ verbs ki tarah behave kartay hain. Inka stem vowel change hota hai (ü → u,ö → o) lekin inhain -te endings miltein hain. Ye aik jayeza hai modal verbs ka simple past tense mein:

‘I wasn’t allowed to go to the cinema.’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Mujhe cinema janay ki ijazat nahi thi’.

‘He couldn’t make it.’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Wo kar nahi saka’.

‘We had to work.’ Urdu mein hoga ‘Humein kaam karna para’.

learning_content.title: Sikhne Ka Tareeqa
learning_content.content: Aik beginner ke tor par, aap shayad simple past tense ko sirf aik ‘receptive’ skill ke tor par istemaal karenge – jab aap German ke text parhte hain jahan aapko sirf alfaz pehchane hain. Jaise ke English mein, ziada tar verbs do main groups mein aate hain: regular or irregular verbs jo mukhtalif patterns follow karte hain. Halanke, verbs forms ko theek se seekhne ka behtareen tareeqa hai verb lists ke saath kaam karna, jo aapko is book ke end mein ya kisi achi dictionary mein mil sakti hain. Try to learn the most commonly used verbs by heart and practise as much as you can – you will soon find that you are much more confident when you are dealing with the simple past tense.

learning_content.title: Exercise 22.1
learning_content.content:
Yeh aik mukhtasar hissa hai mashhoor German fairy tale Schneewittchen (Snow White) se. Text ko parhain aur underline karain tamam verbs simple past tense main. Pehlay do aap k liye kiye gaye hain.

Regular, irregular ya phir mixed hain underlined verbs, unhein classify karain given columns main. Kya aap infinitive bhi dhoond saktay hain har verb ka?

learning_content.title: Exercise 22.2
learning_content.content: In verbs k full simple past tense likhain (sab k liye: ich, du, Sie, er/sie/es, wir, ihr, Sie, sie): (1) spielen; (2) kaufen; (3) wohnen.

learning_content.title: Exercise 22.3
learning_content.content:
Sahi endings supply karain. Kuch cases main ending ki zaroorat nahi hogi.

Misal k tor pe: Er trank eine Flasche Bier.

1: Main Prague main one week k liye reh gaya tha.

2: Kya tum ne football match dekha television par?

3: Usne kal cinema gaya tha.

4: Khane k baad hum ne coffee peeli.

5: Aunty Schneider pehli dafa Scotland gayi thi.

learning_content.title: Exercise 22.4
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences.
1. Kal mein tennis khela.
2. Mein ne aik cup coffee khareeda.
3. Bachpan mein main Frankfurt mein rehta tha.
4. Mein cinema gaya.
5. Mein Germany mein aik hafte reha.
6. Yeh pichle saal tha.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. Simple past tense kab use karte hain?
2. Kis verbs ne simple past tense zyadatar maamlaat mein use kia?
3. Simple past tense k liye verb endings kya hain?
4. Modal verbs aur regular verbs k liye simple past tense kaise banate hain?

learning_content.title: Mustaqbil ka zamen
learning_content.content: Mustaqual ki baat karne ke liye, tum mustaqbil ka waqt istemal karte ho. Anglici me iska izhar karne ke mukhtalif tareeqe hein. Tum 'going to' + fail ke saath aik structure istemal kar sakte ho, kuch qareb ke mustaqbil ki hawale se, ya tum 'will' + fail istemal kar sakte ho. Jab the context se wazeh hota hai ke aap mustaqbil ki taraf hawale de rahe hein, tum barabar pale waqt ki shakal ko bhi istemal kar sakte ho: 'Aj sham me ghar se kam kar raha hoon.'

learning_content.title: German me do mukhtalif shaklen
learning_content.content:
German me bhi mustaqbil ki events ki hawale se different ways hein.

  • Asan tarika aur ziada tar istemal hone wala tariqa hai present time istemal karne ka.
    • Dusra option hai werden + infinitive istemal karne ka:.

    Yahan dono forms tafsil se hein.

learning_content.title: Anaiyayion ki samaj booj karna
learning_content.content: As you can see, there are often bits of information in the sentence which suggest the future. In the ﬁrst example above, the word heute ‘today’ indicates that the event will be taking place later in the day. The second and third examples are even clearer: 'in den Ferien’ ‘in the holidays’ and ‘zum Abendessen’ ‘for supper’ clearly state that the event referred to will take place in the future.

learning_content.title: Mustakbal ki taraf isharay dainay wale fraze
learning_content.content: There are many such expressions. Whenever you are using one of these words, you can quite easily use the present tense because it is evident that you are not speaking about the present. Some examples are given. - Soon: Jald - Later: Bad me - Tomorrow: Kal - In 10 minutes: 10 mint me - In a week: Aik hafte me - Tonight: Aj raat - Next Month: Agle mahine

learning_content.title: Warden + inﬁnitive ki istemal
learning_content.content: The other way of talking about future events uses grammatical forms which are similar in English and in German. Look at the examples given above.

learning_content.title: Future tense in English and German
learning_content.content:
Main zara call karonga aap ko. Kya aap ghar pe honge? Woh saara hafta der tak kaam karega. Film Europe mein release hogi. Woh log August mein ghar shift karenge.

English mein future tense will aur main verb ki infinitive form ka istemal karta hai. Jab k German mein future tense ki formation werden aur main verb ki infinitive form se hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Usage of werden + infinitive in German
learning_content.content:
German language is tareeky ko written German mein, prediction karte waqt, probability indicate karte hue, ya kisi point ko emphasize karne ke liye istemal karti hai.

Examples jaise ke: Kal barish hogi. Woh log shayad Mallorca jayenge. May mein main A levels ka imtihan du ga.

learning_content.title: Points to watch out for
learning_content.content:
Jab aap future tense bana rahe hote hain werden + infinitive ke saath, tab aapko do points par dhyaan dena hota hai. Werden ek irregular verb hai. Is ke saare forms yaad karne chahiye.

Jin mein irregularities include hoti hain: werden ka stem vowel change hota hai du aur er/sie/es ke saath: e → i: du wirst, er/sie/es wird. Du ke form mein stem se d drop ho jata hai: du wirst. er/sie/es ke saath koi additional ending nahi hoti: er wird.

learning_content.title: Lafzi Tarteeb
learning_content.content:
Asal verb hamesha infinitive mein hota hai, aur yeh jumley ya clause ke akhir mein rakha jata hai. Werden finite verb form hai aur yeh doosre position mein hota hai:

  • Der Film wird in Europa rauskommen.
  • Sie werden im August umziehen.

Aap pehle hi is principle se waqif hain modal verbs aur present perfect tense ke sath.

learning_content.title: Angrezi Bolne Walon Ke Liye Tips
learning_content.content:
Jaisa ke saare tenses mein hota hai, German mein future tense ka progressive form ('I will be working') nahi hota. Sirf 'normal' future German mein use hota hai:

  • Ich werde arbeiten.

Future ke bare mein baat karte hue modal verb wollen + infinitive ka istemal na karen. Ich will arbeiten ka matlab 'I will work' nahi hota. Iska matlab hota hai 'I want to work'.

learning_content.title: Prepositions
learning_content.content:
Prepositions aam tor par istemal honey walay alfaz hain jaisay ‘from’, ‘on’, ‘with’, ‘under’, Jo jumlay kay mukhtalif hisson kay darmiyan taluq qaim kartay hain. Wo agahi faraham karsaktay hain:

  • Direction: 'Main Germany se hoon.'
  • Position: 'Kitab Meez par hai' ya
  • Time: 'Woh aath baje aegi.'

learning_content.title: Using prepositions in German
learning_content.content: English aur German mein prepositions ka function bohat milta julta hai. German mein complicates banay is baat ki wajah se hai kyun ke prepositions aam tor par kisi certain case ki zaroorat hoti hai. Jumlay Jaisay ke 'Ich bin aus Deutschland' 'Main Germany se hoon' mein koi issue nahi hota kyun ke article nahi hota. Lekin kisi bhi dusaray structures mein jahan preposition article ya possessive se pehle ati hai, aap ko preposition govern karne wale case aur is se hosaktay huye changes ka pata hona chahiye.

learning_content.title: Prepositions and cases – an overview
learning_content.content:
German mein prepositions ko un cases ki zaroorat ke mutabik mukhtalif groups mein banta ja sakta hai.

Prepositions + accusative case

Prepositions jo hamesha accusative case ke sath aatay hain un ki important examples hain für ‘for/in favour of’ aur gegen ‘against’:

Ich bin gegen den Plan.
Main is plan ke khilaf hoon.

learning_content.title: Zu ‘to’, mit ‘with’ and von ‘from’
learning_content.content:
Ye aksar istemal hone wale prepositions hain jo dative case ko govern karte hain:
Halanki yahan aik misaal di gayi hai lekin iss misaal ko german mai translate na karen.
Mit 'with' ko roman urdu mai 'sath' keh sakte hain.

Aik dusra group aisa bhi hai jaise in ‘in’, auf ‘on’ aur vor ‘in front of’ jo ya to accusative ho sakte hain ya dative, ye is bat par depend karta hai ke emphasize movement par hai ya position par.

learning_content.title: Prepositions + accusative case in more detail
learning_content.content:
Niche diye gaye prepositions hamesha accusative case ke bad atay hain:
bis until
durch through
für for
gegen against, around
ohne without
um around, at
Inki meaning aur usage English aur German mai bohot similar hai, niche kuch misaalein di gayi hain:

learning_content.title: Um, Gegen and other prepositions
learning_content.content:
Yaad rahe ke gegen waqt ke liye bhi refer kar sakta hai: gegen acht Uhr matlab ‘around eight o’clock’.
Um directions ke liye use hota hai – um die Welt matlab ‘around the world’ – aur waqt ke liye: um fünf Uhr matlab ‘at ﬁve o’clock’.

learning_content.title: Mafoom: Mufrad maamruf mai izafat in the accusative case
learning_content.content:
Mufard, malikana ya mufrad mumaraba kein jo maadgi nouns ki taraf ishara karta hai, wo -en mai khatam hota hai:
Kya hum park ke through jate hain?
Main kabhi apne alarm ke bina safar nahi karta.

Mukhtasar forms
Note kijiye ke kuch suraton mai takaddus aur mukammal mumaraba das ko jodte hain: durchs = durch das; fürs = für das.

learning_content.title: Prepositions + dative case in more detail
learning_content.content:
Darj bala takaddus hamesha dative case ke sath require hota hai:
aus = from, out of
außer = apart from
bei = at, near
gegenüber = opposite
mit = with, by (for means of transport)
nach = after, to
seit = since, for
von = from
zu = to

learning_content.title: Endings in the dative case
learning_content.content:
Mufrad mumaraba dative case ke liey zaruri endings hain -em samet male aur ghair maidaan nouns aur -er samet feminine nouns:
Wo train se chali jati hai. (m)
She goes by tube. (f)
Wo cycle se chali jati hai. (nt)

Mukhtasar forms
Note: kuch suraton mai takaddus aur mukammal mumaraba ko milaya jata hai: bei dem often becomes beim, von dem becomes vom, zu der becomes zur and zu dem becomes zum.

learning_content.title: Usage in both languages
learning_content.content:
Bauol zubanon ka istemal. Yaddasht rakhye kay bohot saray prepositions English kay baraber hain, magar kuch jaghoun pe German ka istemal buhat alag hota hai. Jaisay, kisi ki mulaqaat ka zikr kerney kay liye, German mei aus istemal hota hai, jaisay: 'Sie kommen aus Berlin.' jiska matlab hai 'Wo Berlin se aatay hain.'
German mei 'bei' istemal hota hai kisi jagah ko specify kerney ya bataney kay liye keh aap kisi kay pass, unki mulaqaat ya unke sath thahr rahey they, jaisay: 'Potsdam liegt bei Berlin.' yani 'Potsdam Berlin kay nazdeek hai.'
Safar ki wasayel ki taraf isharah kerney kay liye, German mei mit istemal hota hai jaisay: 'Er fährt mit dem Auto.' yani 'Wo car se safar ker raha hai.'
Rastay ya jaghah key directions poochnay per zu istemal hota hai German mei, magar jab hum shehar ya ziyadah tar mumalik ki taraf isharah kertay hain to humay nach ki zarorat hoti hai. In tamam misalon mei, humain muwafiq preposition German mei seekhni hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Prepositions + accusative or dative in more detail
learning_content.content: Kab accusative aur kab dative istemal kerna hai? German mei kuch prepositions ya to accusative ya dative case letay hain, is per depend kerta hai keh emphasis harkat per hai ya position per. Aap shayad is level per in ka sab se ziyada istemal kerenge. German mei 'in' kay sath accusative case aur dative case ka istemal hota hai jab harkat ya position ka zikr hota hai.

learning_content.title: Prepositions
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch tarha ke prepositions diye gaye hain:
at (pe),
on (pe, par),
behind (peche),
next to, beside (kay baghal mein, kay sath),
over, above, across (upar, par),
under, among (neechay, beech mein),
in front of, before (samnay, pehle),
between (darmiyan mein).

learning_content.title: Examples of usage of prepositions
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch misaalien di gayi hain jin mein prepositions ka istemal kia gaya hai:
t Mein kitab ko table par rakhta hoon.
t Kitab table par hai.
t Woh poster ko wall pe laga raha hai.
t Poster wall pe hai.
t Woh CDs ko shelves par rakh rahi hai.
t CDs shelves par hain.

learning_content.title: Prepositions + Genitive Case
learning_content.content:
Kuch prepositions hain jo genitive case kay sath istemal kiye jatay hain. Sab se zaruri yeh hain:
t despite (ke bawajood),
t during (doran),
t because of (ki wajah se),
instead of (ki bajaye).

learning_content.title: Learning tip
learning_content.content:
Mutahassir na hon prepositions ki bareekiyat se. Shruati satah per aap un sab ko istemal nahi karenge. Ek achay course book mein unhe groups mein taqseem kiya jata hai takay yaad rakhna aapke liye asan ho.
Koshish karen ke muqami istemal ke aitbar se unhe yaad karein, ta ke aapko pata ho jab unhe istemal karna hai, aur yaqeeni banayein ke aapko pata hai ke kon sa preposition kon sa case leta hai.

learning_content.title: Summary
learning_content.content:
Yeh ek khulasa hai:

Maqami istemal ke liye, English title aur content ko Roman Urdu mai behtar aur asan parhnay ke liye tahreer karain.

learning_content.title: Exercise 24.1
learning_content.content:
Neechay diye gaye list se muwafiq preposition muhaiya karain. Pehla kam aap ke liye kr diya gya hai.
Agar content exercise ki tarha hai jo user ko test kar raha hai toh sirf khali object return karain sirf taleemi content return karain.

learning_content.title: Exercise 24.4
learning_content.content:
Translate the following sentences:

  • Wo hum mansoobah ke khilaf hain.
  • Hum Park se guzar rahay hain.
  • Mein aam tor par car se jata hun.
  • Hum aik restaurant tak ja rahen hain.
  • Railway station kaisey jaoun?
  • Kya aap cinema ke saath anay wale hain?
  • Weekend ke liye mein Berlin ja raha hun.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
Yad kar sakenge aap ke maqaddama ke sath prepositions accusative case ka estemal karte hain aur kaun se dative estemal karte hain?

Aise kai prepositions hain jo ya to accusative ya dative case ka estemal kar sakte hain. Accusative aur dative ke beech matlab me kya antar hai?

Kya aap beim, ans, im jaise sankshipth roop yaad kar sakte hain Jo khade ke liye hain? Kya aap aise sankshipt roop ke aur udaharan de sakte hain?

learning_content.title: Adjectives kiya hain?
learning_content.content: Adjectives woh alfaz hote hain jo ek noun ke baare main mazeed malomaat dete hain. Jaise 'Ye naya computer hai.': 'Ye exhibition dilchasp hai.': 'Ye kitaab bore kar rahi hai.'

learning_content.title: Usage in English
learning_content.content: Jaisa ke aap in examples se dekh sakte hain, ek adjective ya toh noun ke baad ya uske pehle a sakta hai. English main isse koi masla nahi hota, kyun ke adjective kabhi apne form ko change nahi karta.

learning_content.title: Adjective endings in German
learning_content.content: German main aam taur pe, adjective ka position bohot farq karte hai.

learning_content.title: Adjectives after nouns
learning_content.content: Agar adjective noun jo describe kar raha hai uske baad aata hai, toh wo change nahi hota jaise 'Computer naya hai' aur 'Exhibition dilchasp hai.'

learning_content.title: Adjectives preceding a noun take specific endings
learning_content.content: Agar adjective noun ke pehle ata hai, to aap usme ending dalte hai. Niche diye gaye examples dekhe: 'Computer naya hai. Ye naya computer hai.'

learning_content.title: Samajhnay ki nuktay
learning_content.content: Jaisa keh aap jan chukay honge, zaroori khatma noun ki jins ko darshata hai. Lekin doosre nuktay samajhne ki zaroorat hai: case or ye ke adjective kya nae irrada (ein, eine) se mila hua hai ya muqarrara irrada (der, die, das) se ya phir kisi bhi noun se pehlay baghair article ke. Ye thora pechida lag sakta hai lekin asal mein bohat sara khatmay aik jesay hotay hain or kuch neklay jaa saktay hain.

learning_content.title: Na maloom irrada ke saath sifat
learning_content.content:
Aap ne abhi dekha hai nominative case mein sifat khatmay kaisay kaam kartay hain:

  • Yeh aik naya computer hai.
  • Yeh aik dilchasp numaish hai.
  • Yeh aik boring kitab hai.

Ghaur kijiye ke muqarrara article (der, die, das) ki kami mein, sifat muqarrara article khatmay leta hai (-er, -e, -es) or noun ko 'mark' karta hai, yaani isay mardana, femimine ya khushki hota hai.

learning_content.title: Ilzami Case
learning_content.content:
Ilzami case mein khatmay nominative jaisay hotay hain, siwa mardana noun ko bayan kernay wali sifat, jis mein -en shamil kia gaya hai:

  • Claudia nay aik naya computer khareeda hai.
  • Woh aik dilchasp numaish mein ja raha hai.
  • Woh aik boring kitab parh raha hai.

learning_content.title: Dative case
learning_content.content:
Dative case mein adjective endings asan hain - ve sab -en shamil karte hain. Articles mein zaruri tabdeelian zarur karein. Maslan:
'Mit einem neuen Computer' ko english mein hum kehte hain 'With a new computer one can work faster.' Ya phir, 'Sie trafen sich auf einer interessanten Ausstellung.' ka english tarjuma hoga 'They met at an interesting exhibition.'

learning_content.title: Possessives and kein
learning_content.content:
Yaad rakhein, yeh tamam endings tab bhi lagti hain jab adjective ki peechay possessives (mein, dein, sein vagera) ya manfi kein ho. Maslan:
'Das ist mein neuer Computer.' ka english tarjuma hoga 'This is my new computer.' Aur, 'Das ist keine gute Ausstellung.' ka english tarjuma hota hai 'This is not a good exhibition.'

learning_content.title: Plural forms
learning_content.content: Wazeh rahe ke indefinite article 'a'/ein plural ke liye istemal nahi ho sakta. Possessives aur kein ke baad, tamam adjectives -en shamil karte hain. Nechay di gayi table se mazeed tafseelat hasil karein.

learning_content.title: Summary – adjective endings after the indeﬁnite article
learning_content.content: Yeh an overview hai tamam adjective endings ka indefinite article ke baad. Hum ne genitive case ke liye endings bhi shamil ki hain, halanki aap unka istemal shayad baad mein karenge.

learning_content.title: Adjective Rules i.e Adjectives with no articles
learning_content.content: Naam ke baghair istemaal hone wale adjectives ka pattern indefinite article ke pattern jaisa hota hai. In fact, yeh Nomitative aur Accusative singular mein identical hote hain, jahan noun ke liye adjective 'marker' ki tarah kaam karta hai:

learning_content.title: Nominative Case
learning_content.content:
• Deutscher Wein ist oft süß: German wine hamesha meethi hoti hai.
  • Italienische Pizza ist sehr populär: Italian pizza buhat popular hai.
  • Tschechisches Bier schmeckt gut: Czech beer achi hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Accusative Case
learning_content.content:
• Er mag deutschen Wein: Woh German wine pasand karta hai.
  • Sie liebt italienische Pizza: Usko Italian pizza pasand hai.
  • Er trinkt viel tschechisches Bier: Woh buhat Czech beer peeta hai.

learning_content.title: Dative Case
learning_content.content:
• Fisch passt zu deutschem Wein: Fish German wine ke saath achi lagti hai.
  • Was hältst du von italienischer Pizza?: Italian pizza ke baare mein aapka kya khayal hai?
  • Von tschechischem Bier bekommt man keinen Kater: Czech beer se aapko hangover nahi hoga.

learning_content.title: Plural Forms
learning_content.content: Nominative aur Accusative cases mein plural 'e' add karte hain, aur dative case ko 'en' ending ki zaroorat hoti hai. Iske aur tafseelat ke liye neeche diye gaye table dekhein.

learning_content.title: Adjective Endings in Nominative Case
learning_content.content:
Jab muarif (der, die, das) mange hote hain to wo wazahat se sangya ki ling (gender) ko 'mark' karte hain. Tamam visheshan '-e' jodte hain:

Der blaue Rock sieht gut aus. (Neela skirt acha lag raha hai.)

Die grüne Jacke steht ihr. (Us par hara jacket acha lagta hai.)

Das blaue Hemd kommt aus Italien. (Neeli kameez Italy se hai.)

learning_content.title: Adjective Endings in Accusative Case
learning_content.content:
Jab nominative mein samaanantaran roopta hote hain, mardana sangya ke bad '-en' joda jata hai:

Heute trägt sie den blauen Rock. (Aaj woh neela skirt pehna hua hai.)

Sie mag die grüne Jacke. (Usko hara jacket pasand hai.)

Er kauft das blaue Hemd. (Woh neeli shirt khareed raha hai.)

learning_content.title: Adjective Endings in Dative Case and Plural Forms
learning_content.content:
Dative mein visheshan '-en' jodte hain:

Sie trägt ihren Mantel mit dem blauen Rock/der grünen Jacke/dem blauen Hemd. (Usne apna coat neele skirt/hare jacket/neeli shirt ke sath pehna hua hai.)

As in the dative, all plural forms add '-en'. See the table below for more details.

learning_content.title: Maeyaar-baaz modiﬁers
learning_content.content:
Maeyaar-baaz 'dieser' ‘this’, ‘these’, jeder ‘each’, ‘every’ aur welcher ‘which’, ‘what’ follow the pattern of the deﬁnite article and require the same adjective endings.
For example:
This blue skirt costs only 20 euros. (Ye neeli skirt sirf 20 euro ki hai.)
Each new shirt comes from London. (Har nai shirt London se aati hai.)

learning_content.title: Comparative and superlative adjectives
learning_content.content:
Jab ek noun ke saamne hain, to comparative and superlative adjectives apne endings change kar lete hain.
For example:
They bought a bigger house. (Unho ne ek bara ghar khareeda.)
The best wine comes from Italy. (Behtareen wine Italy se aati hai.)

learning_content.title: Definite article ke baad adjective endings
learning_content.content:
Ye ek overview hai sab adjective endings ke baare mein after the deﬁnite article.
For example:
den blauen Rock (Neela skirt)
die grüne Jacke (Hara jacket)
das blaue Hemd (Neeli shirt)
die neuen Schuhe (Naye shoes)

learning_content.title: Exercise 25.4
learning_content.content:
Mandarja zail jumlay ka tarjuma karen:
1. Salam-o-Alaikum.
2. Shab bakhair.
3. Yeh ek khoobsurat din hai.
4. Usne ek dilchasp kitab khareedi hai.
5. Nayaa computer bohat mehnga tha.
6. Mujhe neelay suit ka shaq hai.
7. Main kaale jootay pehanta hoon.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content:
1. Sifat Naam ke pehle aur baad mein rakh sakte hain. Kaun se sifat naam ko shuru karna chahiye?
2. Tum definite article ke baad adjective endings yaad rakh sakte ho?
3. Tum indefinite article ke baad adjective endings yaad rakh sakte ho?
4. Tum yaad rakh sakte ho, jab koi article istemal na ho to adjective endings kia honi chaiye?

learning_content.title: Numbers and Dates
learning_content.content: Numbers aur dates har zubaan mein ahem hote hain. English aur German mein numbers ki formation aur use mein bohot similarity hoti hai, lekin German mein ordinal numbers (like ‘ﬁrst’, ‘second’ etc.) ko use karne k liye adjectives ki tarha endings ki zaroorat hoti hai.

learning_content.title: Numbers
learning_content.content:
German mein 0 se 20 tak k cardinal numbers yeh hain:

  • 0 null
  • 1 eins
  • 11 elf
  • 2 zwei
  • 12 zwölf
  • 3 drei
  • 13 dreizehn
  • 4 vier
  • 14 vierzehn
  • 5 fünf
  • 15 fünfzehn
  • 6 sechs
  • 16 sechzehn
  • 7 sieben
  • 17 siebzehn
  • 8 acht
  • 18 achtzehn
  • 9 neun
  • 19 neunzehn
  • 10 zehn
  • 20 zwanzig

English ki tarah German mein bhi 'zehen' yaani 'ten' use hota hain 13 se 19 numbers form karne k liye. Yahan note karen k sechzehn aur siebzehn mein s aur en respectively drop kar diya jata hain.

learning_content.title: Das Tens
learning_content.content: 20 se zwanzig, 30 yani dreiβig, 40 yani vierzig, 50 yani fünfzig, 60 yani sechzig, 70 yani siebzig, 80 yani achtzig aur 90 yani neunzig. Notice karo ki dreiβig z ki bajaye ß se spell kiya jata hai. Is tara sechzig main s ko drop kar dia jata hai aur siebzig main en ko.

learning_content.title: 20 se upper Numbers
learning_content.content:
20 se upper numbers bananay ke liye pehle unit number aata hai, phir und aur uske baad dasweh. Yeh English se different hai jaha pehle tens aata hai aur phir single number: jaise twenty-one. German mai yeh literally tarjuma kiya jata hai one-and-twenty.

21 yani einundzwanzig, 32 yani zweiunddreißig, 44 yani vierundvierzig, 56 yani sechsundfünzig etc.

20 se upper numbers main eins ne s ko drop kar dia jata hai (jaise einunddreißig, einundvierzig, etc.).

learning_content.title: 100 aur uske upper Numbers
learning_content.content:
Number banane ke liye pehle hundred ki tadaad do, phir tens aur units add karein jaisa upar explain kiya gya hai:

100 yani (ein)hundert, 202 yani zweihundertzwei, 310 yani dreihundertzehn, 456 yani vierhundertsechsundfünfzig, 889 yani achthundertneunundachtzig

Modern German main normally hundert ke bad und nhi jodtay. Yehi applies hota hai 1000 se uper numbers main:

1020 yani (ein)tausendzwanzig, 7455 yani siebentausendvierhundertfünfundfünfzig, 450000 yani vierhundertfünfzigtausend

learning_content.title: Lambhay Alfaaz aur Adad
learning_content.content:
Aap ne shayad note kiya ho ga ke German mein tamam adad aik hi lafz ke tor par likhay jatay hain. Sirf aik million se zayada ke adad alag-alag likhay jatay hain.
Misal ke tor par, eine Million einhunderttausend (1 100 000) aur zehn Millionen achthunderttausend (10 800 000).

learning_content.title: Tarikhain - Tarteeb Adad
learning_content.content:
German mein tarikhain (pehla, dosra waghera) kehne ke liye:
• -te bhi shamil karain numbers up to 19 tak
• -ste bhi shamil karain numbers from 20 tak.
Ye adad ('pehla', 'dosra' waghera) ko ordinal numbers kehte hain. Kyunki ordinal numbers aam taur par aik noun ke bare mein ziada maloomat dete hain (misal ke tor, 'February ka pehla'), to woh munasib adjective ending laite hain. Aksar agar aik ordinal number ke aage dative case mein preposition ho, to us par dative ending lagati hai, -n shamil karke:
• am vierzehnten Mai (Chauda May ke)
• am dreißigsten April (tees April ke)

learning_content.title: Pehla se Unnees Tak ke Tarteeb Adad
learning_content.content:
Adad unnis tak pehlay se shaamil karain -te:
• erste (pehla)
• zweite (dosra)
• dritte (teesra)
• vierte (chotha)
aur isi tarha aage chaltay jain.
Heute ist der sechste Mai. (Aaj chh May hai.)

learning_content.title: Thoday se be-mutabiq forms
learning_content.content: Note karein kuch thoday irregular forms: der erste (‘the ﬁrst’), der dritte (‘the third’) and der siebte (‘the seventh’).

learning_content.title: Beeswi onward k liye tareeqa kar
learning_content.content:
Twentieth se agay tamam numbers k liye -ste shamil karein:
einundzwanzigste, einunddreißigste.
Jaise ke, 'Heute ist der fünfundzwanzigste Mai.' Ka tarjuma hota hai 'Aaj May ki 25vi tarikh hai.'

learning_content.title: Taarikh k sath ordinal numbers
learning_content.content: kisi bhi tareekh par kuch hota hai, to german me 'am' ka istemal hota hai. 'Am' par dative ending lagti hai. 'Am' (an + dem) k bad dative case ati hai, isi liye -te aur -ste endings me extra -n shamil hona zaruri hai.

learning_content.title: Mazeed izharat
learning_content.content: Mazeed istemal hone wale harf jar jo ke dative case ke sath jate hain wo hain 'seit' matlab 'since'/'from', 'von' matlab 'from', 'zu' matlab 'until'.

learning_content.title: German me saal ka zikar
learning_content.content: Saalon ka hawala dete hue, German 'in' ka istemal nahi karta jaise English me hota hai.

learning_content.title: Berlin's Wall and Goethe's Birth Year
learning_content.content: Die Berliner Mauer girya 1989 mein. Berlin ki Dewaar 1989 mein gir gayi thi. Ye 1989 ko likhne ka ek tariqa hai. Goethe 1749 mein paida hue the. Yani ke siebzehnhundertneunundvierzig. Ye bhi im Jahre se kaha ja sakta hai lekin ye kuch zyada hi shaan daar hota hai: Goethe wurde im Jahre 1749. Goethe baras 1749 main paida hue the.

learning_content.title: Important Events and Festivals in Germany
learning_content.content: Yahan Germany ke kuch important events aur festivals diye gaye hain. In numbers ko der erste, der zweite waghera ke structure mein write out karain. Jaise 'the first', 'the second' etc.

learning_content.title: Content: 6
learning_content.content: Woh saat January ko paida hui thi.t7tMain twenty-eight February ko Munich ja raha hoon.t8tOktoberfest bees September ko shuru hota hai.

learning_content.title: Checklist
learning_content.content: 1 Kya aap twenty ke baad numbers kaise form karte hain? English se kya difference hai? t2 Aap tarikh kaise batate hain? t3 Kisi din kuch hone par tarikh mein kya badal jata hai? t4 Saal ke hawale se English German se kaise alag hai?

learning_content.title: Conjunctions Kya Hain?
learning_content.content: Agar aapke paas ek se zyada clause hain, to usually clauses ek linking word se connected hote hain. Ye linking words 'conjunctions' hain. Ye 'and', 'or', 'but', 'because' jaise words hain.

learning_content.title: Conjunctions se Clauses ke Darmiyan Rishtey
learning_content.content: Mukhtalif conjunctions do clauses ko connect karne ka tareeqa batate hain. Misal ke taur par, aap 'and' ka istemal kar ke simply (ya zyada) clauses ko jod sakte hain, ya phir dusre clause mein pehle clause ke liye wajah batane ke liye 'because' ka istemal kar sakte hain.

learning_content.title: Zyada Ahem Rishton ka Jaaiza
learning_content.content:
Yaha kuch examples hain:

Clause 1: 'He works for Siemens'
Conjunction: 'and'
Clause 2: 'she works for Ford'

Clause 1: 'Will you come at six tonight'
Conjunction: 'or'
Clause 2: 'aren’t you free then'

Clause 1: 'They’ve lived in England for seventeen years'
Conjunction: 'but'
Clause 2: 'they’ve only been in London for a year'

Clause 1: 'He hasn’t answered'
Conjunction: 'because'
Clause 2: 'he doesn’t speak German'

learning_content.title: Do Mukhayya Giroh: Milawat or Zere Tasht
learning_content.content:
German mein, hum Milawat or Zere Tasht ko do bari giroh mein taqseem kar sakte hain.
Milawat conjuction jaise ke 'aber' (magar) or 'oder' (ya) jin ka maamooli taur par do mukhayya jumley milate hain or in per lafz ki tarteeb ka koi asar nahi hota. Inhe hum Milawat Giroh kehte hain.
Zere Tasht jumlon ki misal 'dass' (wah) or 'obwohl' (halan ke) hai. Is giroh ke fiqra aam taur par aik zere tashte jumla taqreeb karate hain or muqarar fiqra ko jumla ke akhir mein bhejte hain.
Koi mantiq nahi hai ke kuch fiqra aik mukhayya jumla ka izhar karte hain or dusre aik zere tashte jumla ka. Aap ko inhe yaad karne ki zaroorat hai.

learning_content.title: Milawat Fiqra Tafseel se
learning_content.content:
Sab se aham milawat fiqra hain:
und (or)
aber (magar)
oder (ya)
denn (kyon ke)
sondern (magar, aik manfi bayan ke baad)
In tamam fiqron ka kaam english fiqron ke siwa karne wala hai. In ka matlub or istemaal agle daakhle mein wazeh kiya gaya hai.

learning_content.title: Und
learning_content.content:
Und wohi istamal kia jata hai jaisay English main 'and' hota hai. Ye do aldoolaat ko jorhta hai, unko 'shamil' karta hai:
Agar subject diye gaye do jotay main same hain jo 'und' se connect hain toh aap doosray jotay main isko repeat kar sakte hain (magar zaroori nahi hain ke repeat karain).

learning_content.title: Aber
learning_content.content:
Aber English main 'but' ki tarha istamal hota hai. Doosri aldoohlat pehli aldoohlat ke mukhalif malomat rakhti hai:
Note karen ke 'aber' ke saamne hamesha comma hota hai.

learning_content.title: Oder
learning_content.content:
Oder English main 'or' ki tarha kaam karta hai. Doosri aldoohlat ek mutabadil izhaar karti hai:
Iss stage pe, jab aap kuch sujhaw dete hain ya jab aap sawal kar rahe hote hain tab aap 'oder' ka zyada istamal karte hain.

learning_content.title: Denn
learning_content.content:
'Denn' angrezi zaban ke 'because' jaise kaam karta hai. Yeh jalasey introduce karta hai jo pehle jalasey ke liye wajah detey hain:

t

Always remember, 'denn' se pehle hamesha comma ata hai.

learning_content.title: Sondern
learning_content.content: 'Sondern' ek negative ke baad 'but' ka idea express karta hai. 'Sondern' ke zikar ke waqt hamesha comma lagaya jata hai. Yeh negative jalasey(contradicting that negative information) ke baad istemal hota hai 'but' ke sense mein

learning_content.title: Subordinating conjunctions
learning_content.content: Subordinating conjunctions ki tarah ke 'dass' yaani 'that', 'obwohl' yaani 'although' ya 'wenn' yaani 'when' introduce a subordinate clause and send the finite verb to the end. Yeh kuch examples hain:

learning_content.title: Dass
learning_content.content: Dass angrezi 'that' ki tarhan istemal hota hai jesy k verbs k baad jesy k 'glauben' yani 'believe', 'meinen' yani 'be of the opinion' aur 'denken' yani 'think' ya phir reported speech k doran (for example, 'sagen' yani 'say' ya 'berichten' yani 'report') ke bad:

learning_content.title: Obwohl
learning_content.content: Obwohl ka istemal aik qualification ya contrast express karne k liye hota hai. Angrezi equivalent 'although' hai:

learning_content.title: Weil
learning_content.content: Weil istemal hota hai angrezi 'because' k liye. Ye 'denn' ke jesa hai lekin ye zyada tar bol chal ki German me istemal hota hai. Halaan k 'denn' aur 'weil' ka mtlb bilkul wesa hi hai.

learning_content.title: Als se istemaal
learning_content.content:
'Als' ka istemaal maazi ke waqt mein kiye jatay hain, jaisa ke ek waqia ya lambay arsay ke liye:

  • Hum wahan nahin the, jab Jens ko hadsa hua.
  • Main Canada mein rehta tha jab main bacha tha.

learning_content.title: Wenn ka istemaal
learning_content.content:
'Wenn' ka do tariqay se istemaal hota hai. Ek English 'if' ke mutabiq hota hai:

  • Agar aap iska shauq rakhte hain, to hum cinema ja sakte hain.
  • Main aapki madad nahin karunga agar aap mehnat nahin karte hain.

Dosra istemaal maazi mein baar baar hote huye cheezon se mutaliq hota hai:

  • Jab bhi usay waqt mila, woh hamesha cinema jata tha.
  • Woh ghar jaate the jab unke paas paisa khatm ho jata tha.

learning_content.title: Wenn ka istemaal (Bar bar maazi mein ya haal mein)
learning_content.content:
Yahan kuch misaalen hain jab 'wenn' ka istemaal bar bar maazi ya haal mein hota hai:

t
  • Woh kabhi farigh nahi hota jab uski girlfriend visit karti hai.
  • Hum ghar mein rehte hain jab barish hoti hai.
  • Hum school nahin jaate the jab hawa 25 darje se zyada garam hoti thi.

learning_content.title: Do verbs in a subordinate clause
learning_content.content: Agar subordinate clause mein ek se zyada verb ki form hai, to finite verb – Jis verb ka form badle – bilkul akhri position pe move hojata hai. Yani:   Max ko aaj afsos ke sath cancel karna parega (Max muss heute leider absagen)  → Jis ki wajah Max ko cancel karna para(weil Max absagen muss).   Main ne uska number bhool gaya (Ich habe seine Nummer vergessen) → Jis ki wajah main uska number bhool gaya(weil ich seine Nummer vergessen habe).  Aksar finite verb ya to modal verb hoti hai ya phir auxiliary verb (haben ya sein).
